Review.Contenu: The worse company ever, The only good part was the first phone conversation. Coz, they wanted to get the job, after that nobody is responsible for anything. They lied several times about the damages then they said they were able to recover 50% of the data and charged me hundreds of dollars.What I received on a flash memory was not even 1% of my photos from the HDD. After a lot of back and forth I got my hard drive back. I was able to recover over 90% of my photos with some free software!

Review.Titre: Very expensive, slow response once payment was made.
Review.Contenu: Very expensive.  Seemed to want to push until payment then took more time than they quoted and made excuses such as they did not have a replacement drive on hand.  In fairness I should have looked around for alternatives.

Extremely disappointing with this company, the way they do business and the end results.  Definitely feel ripped off base on high recommendations.  A fifteen hundred dollar mistake I will never make again! Be warmed this group will rob you.  The only steps they do right is shipping and returns, but they do not put the customer 1st except for communicating to you, their fee and nonrefundable policy which is a scam.  An awful experience!

As feared, this feels like a complete scam. Sent the drive in, got word that everything looked promising.  Paid their $1,700 (with no guarantee of recovery). Lots of encouraging updates, parts being bought, (even though I sent them an identical perfectly working drive for parts), etc. (Probably scripted). Got word two weeks later that zero data could be recovered. The product was an external backup drive that got dropped. Feels like a perfect scam

SCAM! DO NOT DEAL with this company!! Fields Data Recovery was extremely misleading and scam ! They ensured me that they had a 97% success rate with no charge if they could not recover lost files from my device and would ship back at no charge. After their assessment, they called and stated that it was 99 % possible and this operation involves skilled engineering time and have to send it out to a level 5 lab which have three options for prices, immediate 3280 3-6 days , express 2180 1-2 weeks  and longer time 3-4 weeks would have to charge me $1,480 .00 regardless of if they were successful or not, which they most likely would not be and will take 2-3 weeks and i have to $3500 if want in a week. What a loss of $1680! Not to mention I had shipped my computer and were holding for 3 week and gave me computer back after charging me more $80 with pen drive with information that i have recovered without much knowledge. they are very polite till get computer and then you hardly can get in touch and cold  If you want quality CARE, SERVICE and GUARANTEE save your time and money and go with a legitimate company!

Review.Titre: Drive was never returned as promised
Review.Contenu: Quoted a very high price once they received my hard drive, and got an attitude when I declined to pay the price.  They never returned the hard drive despite my request and their stated policy.

Review.Titre: DO NOT DEAL with this company!
Review.Contenu: SCAM! DO NOT DEAL with this company!! Fields Data Recovery was extremely misleading! They ensured me that they had a 97% success rate with no charge if they could not recover photos from my device and would ship back at no charge. After their assessment, they called and stated that it was a complicated retrieval and they would have to send it out to a level 5 lab which they would have to charge me $1,500.00 regardless if they were successful or not, which they most likely would not be. What a loss of $1,500! Not to mention I had shipped my phone in a sturdy box with 3 protective foam barriers, in its original iPhone 13 box which they had thrown out. The packaging that they returned my iPhone in was absolutely absurd!!! My iPhone was shipped back to me in a small box with absolutely no protective barriers. It was wrapped in one thin plastic cover to a thin cardboard box exposed which could have easily crushed and damaged my phone! I contacted the manager who was unapologetic and stated that they toss any packaging out and that was the way they ship out their devices. If you want quality CARE, SERVICE and GUARANTEE save your time and money and go with a legitimate company!

So, I sent an old 1.5TB Western Digital external hard drive from about 10yrs ago to see how much it would be to recover the information.  Older attempts were way outside my price range, but was told the information was recoverable.  I learned quite a bit about hard dives in an attempt to possibly recover it my self.  I knew it would take some new basic parts and a clean room.  Access to a clean room is what I did not have.  I did purchase a working hard drive that was same model, and with in a month or so of manufacturing date and lot number for good working parts.  I had already  written the hard drive off due to age but there was some sentimental stuff I would have liked to retrieve.  The hard drive died due to a power surge from 220v lines in Iraq after an attack on our base. Apparently telling the company that the information is important gives it a good story and therefor to them makes it more valuable.  At first great communication with Adam and he was really, confident about the outcome.  Of course, always with the caveat they can't guarantee. Of course after they received both Hard drives, the original and the parts drive the immediately performed a base diagnostic and said they would need to order parts because the extra drive I sent was bad too. Should have been my red flag.  Well, the non-refundable/non-guarantee price for parts and labor at $1384.35 was cheaper than the 2,500 quoted 10 years ago for a guaranteed recovery, still more than the $400 they base on their site and over the initial on the phone.  I reluctantly paid cause I was hopefully for a good outcome and get back photos/video from wedding, deployment and basically anything from before I was 25.  Thats when it all went down hill.  I waiting through the week with no word, looking forward to an email or phone call with some kind of update or progress as they had done to quickly get me a quote.  After a week or so I decided to call Adam and left a message.  He called back relatively quickly with bad news. He claimed to be reading notes from engineers, and that after replacing pretty much the entire hard drive they were unable to get any information from it and it was unrecoverable.  At first, I was kind of surprised due to the positive attitude toward a success before but then immediately shocked when there was a rush to destroy the hard drive instead of sending it back to me.  As he has highlighted specifically the value to me.  So here I am with no data, loss of $1300+ and waiting to receive my hard drives.  I will perform an inspection when I get them back as I recorded the serial numbers of the internal components to see of anything was actually replaced, as I paid for the parts I should receive the parts. If they were not, I will be notifying the FBI for fraud and filling fraud against my credit card and the BBB. The reason I have gone down this route are the quickness to get quote and payment, no contact once payment received, touting success with little caveat, suddenly parts that were good are now damaged beyond repair, and the quickness to destroy instead of returning the drive.  Thank you for listening. No company should take payment before service performed, always ends in fraud.

To all honest people, be careful, they are scam, i said it and they did promise to recover the data after Mr. Steve make me to pay the full price and then he said that they tried, but i didn't work?????picture showed that they bought a new drive and tried to use the parts. SCCAAAAM

Beware of any place that does not provide pricing up front. I don’t think this business is a scam, but they are scammers. After a conversation with one of their reps where he questioned me about what data I hoped to recover I sent them 4 drives. The level of communication and helpfulness dropped steeply once they had my drives. They never replied to emails and I had to chase them to get the results of their recovery efforts (they lost my number). In the end, the drive that had what the rep knew I was looking for was not the oldest drive I sent, not the largest, not the drive with the most files, but it was, just coincidentally, the most expensive to recover. Initially I said yes and gave my credit card info, but after reading the “no guarantees, no refunds” contract on which they had put an incorrect (and much higher) charge price, I decided not to sign, not to proceed with the recovery and asked for my drive to be returned. It has been nearly two weeks now and they have not responded, not returned my drive and not returned my money. So if you’re going to use them, just beware. And be vague. Don’t tell them what you’re looking for, because I do believe this company can do what they say they can do, but where they could choose to be honest and genuinely helpful, they choose to be greedy and to gouge.

Review.Titre: I was skeptical and I’m glad… feels like scammers
Review.Contenu: I was considering this company to recover my hard drive. I was not in a rush to do this, they continuously called to re-email the shipping label that expires after a certain amount of time and when I explained to British accent Steve that I didn’t have the hard drive out of my computer yet, he wanted me to send in my computer so they could take it out for me, which I was not going to do and had been told by another employee there to not send in the entire computer, I told him I needed time to retrieve my computer and he just hung up on me after rude customer service. I called him back and told him to remove my number from their system. I’m glad I went with my gut feeling and did not use this company as they seemed eager to get what they could, were unprofessional and rude.

The process seemed pretty straight forward and similar to other data recovery companies. Ship them the drive and they will work to recover it. Almost immediately after filling out a form on their site on June 21st 2022 I received a call from [REDACTED] asking if I'd received the shipping label. I asked a few questions about shipping and recovery which she was happy to answer so I shipped the drive, what could possibly go wrong, they promised to return with shipping paid in the unlikely event they were unable to recover the data.Three days later I received an email and a phone call from [REDACTED] where he said parts would be required to repair the drive which would cost a non-refundable upfront fee of $1,425 and an additional fee of $60 once the recovery was completed. This seemed steep so I asked for a few days to think it over, in the meantime I did some research and given the parts / labor required it seemed like a costly, but not altogether absurd amount.On June 29th 2022 I receive an email from [REDACTED] who's signature reads "Head of EU & US Sales Fields Data Recovery" with no reference to previous estimates he informed me that the cost was variable, based on urgency:Standard turnaround 3-4 weeks --  $960Expedited turnaround 1-2 weeks -- $1300Emergency turnaround 2-4 days -- $1620upfront payment, non-refundable and an additional $89 would be due after recovery. He called me shortly after sending the email to ask if I had any questions, answering them with what now seems like a rehearsed spiel about how technician labor is costly, parts are costly and there are no guarantees in this business, I was duped.After paying I tried reaching out by phone and email to all three and received no answer from any of them. Over 2 weeks later I received my device from UPS in the exact same state as I sent it, nothing has been changed or replaced on it. Given that nothing whatsoever was done on the device makes it quite clear that this is a scam, they take your money, hold the device for a few days and then ship it back as if nothing happened.

I truly believe this is an indiscriminate scam. I’ll try to make a long story short, the details are important. The lone survivor of my immediate family was murdered and I contacted several companies in my effort to distinguish who would be the most honest and capable, obviously I failed this time. When I first contacted Field Data Recovery they were not as business-like, on the second contact and after explaining the facts of my living and dire financial situation of no income etc., that this was my last hope in finding the killer and recovering precious files and pictures (but didn’t have the pass code) to the devices, they seemed sympathetic. They told me that the lost passcode would not be a problem and asked what I wanted to retrieve. I told them and continued speaking with other reputable companies, who had money back guarantees, and when I thought I had found the right company,  contacted Fields and informed them out of courtesy. The subsequent conversation seemed very heartfelt and it was explained to me that they hoped I would find someone reputable and gave points to consider in finding the right company. This conversation really touched my heart and I decided to go with Fields. All the money that I had in the world to pursue this, keep myself alive and a roof over my head, was paid to Fields. Bad, bad decision! They couldn’t even get past the passcode and it took some creative communication to even get that much of an answer. I have been devastated over this loss and sent a message to the owner/supervisor, the response from (The person who took over the contact) was a phone call and he simply said, “We’re not returning your money. We priced it at a very low rate.” I couldn’t believe $1500 was the least expensive that they could go, it’s still unbelievable to me that they resorted to such a statement when I hadn’t asked for my money back but instead wanted change in their system so that this didn’t happen to people in the future. Don’t get me wrong, the money would be exceptionally welcome and needed, I just did not want this to happen to anyone else. It took over two weeks and a couple inquiries to get a response about the results, although I was initially told it would only be a few days. They did receive my package the day after I sent it, I didn’t get it back until another two weeks after my supposed result. The thing I am not 100% positive about is whether or not they actually did anything because both devices were still on the same timeframe for the pass code as I had left them. I am going to contact reputable companies and inquire about all of these practices/results. I’m obviously disappointed in myself for buying into their sales pitch and going with a company, pretty much the only company without a moneyback guarantee. However, what they told me from the beginning was obviously a falsehood.With the response I received, the service etc. I’m completely baffled that they’re still in business, that sort of practice is unacceptable from where I stand: unprofessional and dishonest. I’m considering legal action and have been told it’s an easy win. Please be careful and protect yourself so it doesn’t happen to you.

Lies Lies Lies Lies LiesThis company is a SCAM company. They will lure you in with cheap quote, only to call you to state that it will be over £800+VAT to recover, along with the ubiquitous "Well, how much is your data worth".Quite surprised they are in business still, so I aim to close them down once and for all. Enough is enough, here is your nemesis.

Review.Titre: $1200 for port change...local shop did it for $15
Review.Contenu: I mean customer service was fine BUT....they wanted to charge me $1200 to fix a messed up port on a hard drive. Then I managed to find a local place who said they take a look and give it a try. The guy at FIELDS then wanted to close a deal at $675...50% off now really?? Needless to say I got my drive back from FIELDS and the local shop did a enclosure swap and charged $15 - took 2 mins to fix......

Paid 640$ to get my seagate hard drive fixed. Said it was going to be at least a two week operation. Instead, they had it for less than a week and declared the repairs and data recovery a failure. They sent back the external hard drive without the outside plastic casing and without the power cable and adapter cable that I sent with it. Now they won’t respond to any of my emails. Terribl terrible service

The price will go up.  They start at $199.00 to get your device in.  In my case, just a regular portable hard drive, the price went up to almost $1000.00  When I asked for it to be returned, it came back in pieces.  When I complained about that, they originally said they would put it back together.  Then a few days later they called and said they were just going to ship me the parts and I had to put it back together.  LIke I'm a computer tech??

This company is a joke! They Charged me $1500 to recover my data and they failed. Mr Cass Davis told the plate of the drive is in good condition and they need to order head parts to recover data from it, it took 3 weeks, which is also crazy. Then they told me that 3 attempts of recovery failed so I asked for refund. Mr Cass Davis told me that I paid for attempts to recover it and I wont get any refund. However I just read their terms and conditions and it clearly says if they wont be able to recover files they will issue refund. DO NOT TRUST THEM !!

Review.Titre: $800 to TRY to fix an SD card…
Review.Contenu: $800 to TRY to fix an SD card containing the final pics of my now deceased husband. Can't pay that! Six weeks later, I still do not have my SD card back. Their communication sucks. I don't trust a thing they said about their diagnosis of my corrupted SD card. Be Leary! I wouldn't ever attempt to use them again. This company is awful. They don't care about you, just the money. Look elsewhere. I fear my memories are lost. I hate them.

Review.Titre: i was trusting this company to fix my…
Review.Contenu: i was trusting this company to fix my phone, they not only advised me they "see data recovery problems " often and they would fiX the phone..took my $$, never fixed the phone, took forever to send my phone back and never returned my $. WORST UNRELIABLE COMPANY. WOULD NOT RECOMMEND TO ANYONE.

Review.Titre: Disaster! Never send anything to these guys
Review.Contenu: Disaster. Never send any disk or media for recovery. spent $1600. Failed to recover anything from two disks. The whole thing about free diagnosis is hoax to get you pay. Never got response from manager. Received only one original disk back.  I could recover the data from that one disk using another service.

Their marketing is misleading. The free diagnostics they provide result in a less than 50% success rate according to the Account Manager I spoke with. That means you might get a file list of recoverable data prior to being hit with a bill 50% of the time. Their marketing should read that 50% of cases require further diagnostics that start at $495. This was my experience. Now I'm waiting to receive my drive back to send it to the manufacturer for a recovery.

I send my SD Card for recovery and they tell me that It will cost me $950 to perform a recovery operation that they do not guarantee it will work and also I have to pay $500 non returnable in advance. How can you pay $500 for something that  does not going to work. And to return my card they wanted me to pay them $20 to do it fast. Or free to return it in regular Mail. Is been 2 months and I haven't received yet. I call and the person who attend me is busy.

I sent in my crashed hard drive for USEFUL data recovery. Boy was I deceived into believing that they had actually recovered some USEFUL data. What I got for $500 was total worthless non-useful garbage, to any human being. This company should be shut down for their deceitful tactics and extortion of peoples money.

They sent me this first:...your device has been ruled as a failed NAND device. A Monolith Chip Lift (MCL) is necessary for this recovery. ... The total cost for this will be $1800.00 Of that, $900 would be due up front for the additional labor. The $900 upfront is non-refundable, however we have a 75% success rate in performing a MCL...After I decline to pay $900 up front, my device was returned after two weeks, but the CHIP is GONE! AVOID Fields Data Recovery!!

Awful service. Once they are paid, neither George or Alex return calls. They sent an empty hard drive the 1st time. 2nd time, the files were so hard to find and go thru, I couldn't find as much as they promised. Terrible service. Don't use or trust.

Great service to get you to send your hard drive to them. After that forget it. 2 weeks they look at my drive. They told me they had to put new heads in ok great. 1 week later they called back. The heads they put in from there stock which was used didn't work. So for 800 they will bring in a new set of heads and get my info off my hard drive. They are nothing but a bunch of kids. Don't send them anything !!!!!!!!  Now they are sending me back my drive haha we will see about that

Review.Titre: Scam artists who should be investigated
Review.Contenu: I received 7 sales calls before I sent my failed external hard drive to St. Louis. Only a day or two after it was shipped, I got a call saying that the drive was unreadable most likely due to bad read/write heads. If I paid them $800 they would install new heads and there would be a 90% chance that my data would be recovered. I paid the $800. A couple days later I got an email letting me know that it had been a total failure & no data was recovered. What a racket! This company is a total scam artist. They should be investigated.

I sent them a defective flash drive and a brand new one (to use for saving and returning any recovered data). After their initial evaluation, they wanted a non-refundable $400 upfront to attempt to fix the bad drive and gave us an estimated 50% success rate. We decided it was too much money for a 50/50 chance at recover so I asked them to return both drives. After 5 weeks 3 email requests to return the drives, they returned the bad drive.... and apparently decided to keep the new one for themselves.

Review.Titre: Their Google ad says starting at $199…
Review.Contenu: Their Google ad says starting at $199 and was also told if I didn't use their service, my drive would be returned quickly. 5 weeks later I finally received my drive with case damaged. Their customer service is awful and they will hold your drive hostage if you choose not to use them.

Absolutely the worst customer service on earth. Their director of customer service is an absolute liar, 8 months now, and they still refuse to return my drive!!! Insanity!! They did not follow any of their own guidelines, no file list was ever sent. The even tried to tell me that my drive had been lost in the mail, when tracking clearly showed they had signed for it.Such an absolute scam!!! Do not give them any money!!! Read the Multiple horror stories on Yelp and google fields data recovery scam, I wish I had before giving a dime to these thieves.

Quoted 300-700 over the phone by sales prior to sending data then told 2000-3000 after data deemed recoverable. Debated their lack of integrity with a rep who repeatedly talked over me. Got drives back to have recovered elsewhere. The internet is filled with scam reviews on these guys. Stay away!

Review.Titre: Please stay away from this firm
Review.Contenu: Please stay away from this firm. The company gives a low ball estimate to lure you to ship your data/hard-drive to them. Thereafter, they will come back with a very high price quote as they know that they you are in a relatively vulnerable position. If you refuse and ask them to ship your hard drive back,,,which I did after paying them for the return shipping...they returned my hard drive in a very poorly packaged condition. I fear my hard drive is now damaged and I will not be able to give it to another vendor for data recovery.

Review.Titre: They basically stole my social security…
Review.Contenu: They basically stole my social security money. They said they could get the photos off of my tablet. They wanted $500 to start. I paid and sadly got nothing except a broken tablet. They claimed to have to take my tablet apart to do the process, but they refused to give me so much as an invoice. My credit card company said too bad, because they claim to have returned a disk with the tablet. Told scam job, then I got hit with a foreign transaction fee. This business is located in St. Louis, Missouri. Once I questioned this fee they cut off communication.

Review.Titre: The Truth about Fields Data Recovery
Review.Contenu: I felt like this was classic "Bait & Switch."  I was given an estimate and, while high, I could afford it so I sent my drive in.  A few days later the price more than doubled.  I was told there would be no problem putting the data on a larger capacity drive for a small increase in price.  When the option came to do that I was discouraged from making that choice.  The brand of hard drive I was told I would get was not as promised.  The drive received was a cheap pocket drive I could not install in my desktop.

Review.Titre: Gave my hard disk to be recovered 2 …
Review.Contenu: Gave my hard disk to be recovered 2 months ago. Took them ages to respond to me and almost after a month they told me that they can't recover it and told me that they will ship it. It's now a month since i haven't received my hard disk. I called several times to get response but they always say the person who handles my case is over on another line and would call me back but never did. Not even once. Terrible customer care and the Tech (Erik) the worest person to deal with. I don't recommend them to anyone. I am sooo upset!!!

They were very helpful in receiving my order. Once they got my money they were not at all responsive. I paid for emergency diagnostic and I did not receive the phone call letting me know that the results were in. I had to call and ask. I requested report and I received 4 bullet points in email. I requested to send hard drive be returned to me FEDEX and it was not done. I had to pay extra for overnight and even though they received my payment I was not notified of tracking #. When I called it was still sitting in shipping department. Not at all happy with their services. The amount of money I paid I was very dissatisfied. Will not use them again.

Review.Titre: Fields did not return my Property or refund my $600
Review.Contenu: Do Not work with these people they stole or would not return my hardware and $600. I sent 2 drives 1 good and identical 1 bad (Dropped on floor-mechanical issue). There was nothing wrong with the platters yet FDR failed to retrieve any info and only returned 1 drive. Not returning my 2nd drive is theft! It is larceny to keep a customers property. Any recommendations how to press charges? I am doing everything to hold FDR accountable and disputed payment on the $600. There was significant personal confidential info on that drive! Help Hold this Company Liable for their Actions!

Every positive review is FAKE. absolute crooks!! Manager , customer services managers (both females.)  All service reps, spoke to 5... trust pilot made me remove their names but the other sites don't. Trust pilot doesnt allow individuals to held accountable for their personal involvement in fraudulent actions but thankfully ALL of the other sites do!.  All of the employees were horrible! paid $500 NEVER got my data or refund. Just excuses and the run around. I cannot believe this, I will follow up with the appropriate authorities . Wish I could give a zero star rating!!

They originally quoted me a price that was much lower than anyone else.  Based on the symptoms I described, they told me they were 80% confident they could recover the data from my hard drive.  2 weeks passed and they told me I needed to pay a nonrefundable fee of $400 so they could order new parts for my hard drive.  3 more weeks passed and they told me they couldn’t recover my data – they gave me a worthless reason why they couldn’t recover the data but the story sounded fabricated.  Don’t waste your time, your money, or your patience with this company.

Terrible Company. Total rip off. I paid to have my data expedited and it took them 2 weeks to respond. I ended up paying $1800 for nothing. They said they could not do anything after they took my money. It was a basic procedure with a small external hard drive.

Scam. Took me for almost $900. No data, no hard drive.Told me there was data, I paid and never got anything. They tell me there was a slip up. No data, no hard drive. They told me repeatedly they would send it to me. One lie after the other. No refund.

Charged way above their expected estimate! Told me that 99.5% of my drive had been recovered, yet the ONLY folders I told them I'd need weren't recovered.  Of course, I only found that out AFTER I paid them $700 for a mess of documents I didn't need. They tell you that you get a list of the files they recover to make sure it's worth recovery, but then you get partial screenshots making you think you got the documents you need, when in reality,  you didn't. I have dealt with customer service for months, no returned emails, phone calls, or hard drive.  FIND SOMEONE ELSE!!!

Review.Titre: DO NOT DEAL WITH FIELDS DATA RECOVERY
Review.Contenu: This companythis company uses a bait-and-switch technique that is more based on sales than technical expertise. I know for a fact that they have meetings where they are told how to hook a customer and get them to send there Drive-In very easily, if not too easily! Once they have your drive they have you :-) if you change your mind they will say they've already taken your drive apart, they've lost your drive, or you will have to wait 3 to 5 weeks.I fought for them for a month to get my drive back. OnTrack data recovery got my data back within 5 days and treated me like a king.DO NOT DEAL WITH FIELDS DATA RECOVERY

Unequivocally one of the lowest forms of scams one can devise. These animals prey upon your need to recover priceless files and data.  Do not in any way shape or form send your devices to this company as you will be asked to pay $800 upfront after speaking to a tech who will then make him/herself (Eric Martinez) unavailable to any and all forms of communication.  Then you will have the misfortune of speaking only to a bumbling dope named Michael Schneblen who will refuse to give you any sort of status updates.  This is a scam I should have seen coming a mile away but I was in desperate need of help and they dirtbags did what dirtbags do.  STAY CLEAR.

horrible!!!!!!!!! All positive reviews are not the truth beware very rude and will not return your item on time nor the way it was send out to them. I received my external hard drive wrapped in plastic without the original package. It is literally trash now! They are scamming people with good reviews and they are nice first than they call you names and tell you that you crazy and not the only one sending in items. Does that mean you have to break my stuff and send me my item back unpacked? I am not joking. They are very rude and very unprofessional! Do not believe what they say. Choose someone else and keep your hands away from them. DONT DO IT DO NOT DO IT.

Review.Titre: I did get my data BUT...don't let the …
Review.Contenu: I did get my data BUT...don't let the "from" $199 suck you in.  YOUR drive will be "far more difficult than originally thought."  So it's not $199 it's $1204!  Then when you ask what they did.  They won't tell you.  It took many emails to get any answer what so ever.  They promise to return your original drive in 7 - 10 days.  That was back in June (it is now August) and I am still waiting.  My contact Josh Carter won't even return my emails! This has been very frustrating.  Once they have your data...you basically HAVE to do what ever they say it you want a chance at getting it restored!  Broke/sad customer!

I sent both a SD card and a hard drive into them and BOTH times was the exact same cost, which I didn't do either one because it was outrageous and seems very odd to me that it would be the same price no matter what. They wanted $400 up front that was non-refundable for non-guaranteed results and an additional $400 for the data IF they recovered data to get the data back, which THEY said they only have a 70% recovery rate according to their quote. Then they stop responding to emails when I told them I didn't want to pay the money for the service, they are rude on the phone when trying to find out where the drive is, and they take OVER a month to finally send back your drive!

The original person I worked with was super pushy. At first when I called to ask about the services I said that I couldn't have it fixed and he said to me "we'll do you not want your data recovered." Of course who doesn't want their data recovered. If I didn't care I wouldn't have called. When I finally did the service they said I needed to purchase another external hard drive which I sent to the address they provided along with the drive that was broken. When I received the package back I got a different hard drive and didn't even receive my old one back and had to call and speak to a supervisor to get my drive back. I would not recommend to anyone.

Review.Titre: The only time "FDR" used my contact information was for payment.
Review.Contenu: A friend recommended them to me so I trusted they were competent. He sent in the  Hard Drive and they said it would cost $880. I called them to give them my contact information and pay. I gave them all my pertinent information, paid the $880, and never heard from them again. The paperwork I got when I paid had a support email address that I tried twice and never got a response so I called 3 months later and they had the wrong name on the account and couldn't even call me by my name, on the phone, though I gave it to them twice. Come to find out they had decided that nothing was recoverable on the second month and couldn't contact me to let me know that my $880 was for naught. I wouldn't recommend this company to anybody.

Review.Titre: There's a reason why they have an F…
Review.Contenu: There's a reason why they have an F rating on BBB.  Won't return phone calls and won't return your hard drive.  Try to upsell you on $800-$1000 worth of data recovery services.

Review.Titre: This company is a rip off
Review.Contenu: This company is a rip off. They trick the consumer with low prices quotes. When I complained and wanted my product sent back, the agent, threatened that I wouldn't see my product for two weeks. And they tried to bill me for returning my HD's. If they have tampered with my HD's they will see me in court after I file a complaint with the Attorney General. DO NOT USE THIS COMPANY. PS. I asked to have my HD's returned. In the process of extracting the data they destroyed my HD's. The price quote was outlandish and they first told me it was just a quote, $200 each, but they ruined my property, then sent it back to me. Their attitude was arrogant, as if no one else was as cheap, and they had a corner on the market. DO NOT EVEN GO NEAR THIS COMPANY!

Review.Titre: my experience with fields data recovery…
Review.Contenu: my experience with fields data recovery was so awful,rude people and on top of that they didn't recovery my data out all! wouldn't recommend seek other alternatives!

Review.Titre: Repair service 5% and the one of the worst customer service I have had
Review.Contenu: Per their internet advertisement and speaking with them I sent them my phone to the company. They charged $244  to buy parts to fix my cell phone and stated that their company recovers most of the data and pictures about 90% total. I had pictures of family vacations and very important business contact. WAS SUPPOSED TO BE COMPLETED IN 10 days. After many attempts to call which everyone took ALLEDGED messages and NO ONE called back (spoke to the manager many times). After 2 MONTHS and paying a charge for recovery of $400 they assured me it was completed. I have hardly any pictures (which have priceless vacations, family events) also all the contacts have to be entered manually (now that no excuse for your recovery technical skills ).  I am not happy at all. My opinion stay away.They kept my fixed phone as well.

I sent them my drive on August 14th. I paid $800 for "expedited service." Today, 5 weeks later, and only after I have made dozens of calls to them, they tell me the "engineer" just tried to fix your drive and it doesn't work.  They had been telling me the engineer was extracting data and everything looked good, just stringing me along and wasting my time. This is after five weeks and expedited service! The absolute worst customer service imaginable. Kris Nordberg never would call, unless I called him. He never had any details, only that a "whole team of engineers" was working on it! Oh, and he was "upset" it was taking so long! HE WAS UPSET! So very disappointing. I will be disputing the charge and letting the Better Business Bureau know of these crooks!

They quoted me far less than everyone else. Was extremely professional at first. Took a while for them to verify the problem. They kept calling me to keep me updated at first. Then they told me the problem and said they would have to start with a nonrefundable $400.00. All other companies thought they could recover and this one seemed so professional so I proceeded. Once it was paid for, I did not receive another call from them. I had to call for updates and they kept telling me that there was a delay due to a mistake on their part. Finally they called me two months later just to tell me they could not recover my data with no explanation. Once the service was paid for, the professionalism was gone. I received my hard drive back not in the condition I sent it to them and with no static bag to protect it. Would not recommend to anyone.

Review.Titre: I packaged and sent a flash drive along…
Review.Contenu: I packaged and sent a flash drive along with a new flash drive to be returned with recovered data.  Fields acknowledged receipt and implied they would advise an update within two days.  Two weeks later having heard nothing I called, several times, each time receiving a promise to call back which never happened.  About 18 days after sending I spoke to a tech who said they were about 80% or so done.  Another two weeks and unanswered calls resulted in being told they never received a damaged drive, only the new one. No explanation on why they didn't advise when the received package but sent email implying they had it.  After several attempts thru BBB still get the same story.  They do not appear to be a responsible company and care not at all about customer service.  They also do not appear to be truthful.  You are strongly encouraged to take your business elsewhere.

I first learned Of the organization from a Web search. He explained to me that they had a high success recovery percentage.  After the initial review he indicated that they could recover the most of the data because they could see the so call image but it cost 500 dollars.  I was given the impression that it would be successful but they stated it had a chance of failure.  They know when things could be accomplish verses chances of failure.  They told me that they recovered over four hundred drives a week. The reps name was [Name]. They have the experience to guide customers from spending money or not.  No honor in this company. They are about the money. It has been months since got notice that my data could not be recovered and I have not received my drive each back. Never again with this company Nor will I recommend anyone or colleagues to them.

I have never in my life been so outraged by poor customer service as I have dealing with Fields Data Recovery. First of all, it took two weeks before I received any communication from my Account Manager in the St. Louis office. The company advertises a 24 hour diagnosis. I would have called to see what was happening sooner, but I was traveling. When I did receive an email it was to ask for a password on a device that was at least four years old, so I wasn't able to get it right the first time. I didn't receive another email for another week to ask for another possible password. When I emailed to complain I was essentially taunted by my representative. Insulting customers is not the way to do business. When I called the New York office to submit a formal complaint I was channeled back to my bad mannered representative. When I tried to call again, I got his manager, who hung up on me. I was not being unreasonable.

Review.Titre: Poor service, Unethical and a total scam
Review.Contenu: After providing the Fields Data Recovery with my computer hard drive for recovery services I was provided an outline of fees and services that would be performed.  I felt that the offered services were not adequate and requested my drive be returned. At this point, the Fields Data Recovery representative stopped responding to my email inquiries and could not provide clear direction into if or when my drive was/would be mailed out.After numerous phone calls and almost a month of back and forth about where the drive was, I've finally been told that the drive may be lost, and they were not responsible, deeming the value of the drive being only 1 dollar.  While the drive may have been broken, it was still valuable, as it was under warranty and was scheduled to be returned to the manufacturer and replaced with a similar value, drive (in this case a 1TB drive roughly $135). So, essentially, as far as I'm concerned, I've been robbed of $135.

They are rip off artistThey are rip off artist! DO NOT DO NOT TRUST THEM half of the reviews with 5 star 🌟 were by them! I sent my equipment to them, they gave me this outrageous price so they delayed sending my data back over one month cause I refused them! Then I sent it elsewhere they told me it’s had been open so it can’t be recovered now! I called FDR and asked y they do that? So they then apologized then told me they would eliminate $200 off price if I allowed them to do recovery I agreed then they tacked an extra $80 for their fee😬! I sent it back to em 3 was later I gave Mgr a call, who would NOT return my calls but sent an email "WE WONT CHARGE THE $20 to send ya  back to u" but not getting ya refund for a repair that never happened! THEY DELIBRATELY DAMAGED MY HARD DRIVE SO NO ONE ELSE WAS ABLE TO FIX IT IF THEY COULD NOT...I sued them N WON! Run run run from this scam, they're scammers! NOT EVEN WORTH ONE STAR, NEG 5s***😈👹

Absolutely HORRIFIC service. Please AVOID.  I repeat...DO NOT USE their service.  In the beginning my primary contact, Eric K, was pleasant.  Constant contact through the entire troubleshooting effort.  However, once I paid $1800 for the raid recovery, he would not respond to my emails or phone calls and I had not received my data or hard drives in over 3 weeks.  After several attempts, Mr. K finally answered one of my calls and had the audacity to tell a paying customer (i.e., me), "Why are you hounding me.  You will get the drives when you get them."  Well, I finally got my hard drives back today (after 2 months) and I just wanted to share the condition and the level (lack) of respect this company has towards their customers.  The image below shows the condition I received my 4 hard drives, in a beaten up previously used amazon box which by the way someone could place a hand in and take the hard drives.  I repeat..yet again...please AVOID Data Field Recovery.

Review.Titre: Bad service from St. Louis office…
Review.Contenu: After they received my drives they could not deliver what they promise me at the initial call. when I asked for the disks back the agent stopped returning my calls. I asked to talk with a supervisor, she promised to look into the issue and get back with me. she sent me high level of files they can recover with out any details to what they can recover exactly or what I am going to get back for my money. when I asked for the disks again back they gave me the run around and it will take 3-5 day to ship them. Talked with another supervisor-since they have a lot of them- and he agreed to give me a detail list of the files they can recover as long as I agree to stay with them for the rest of the process. Finally I got the data but it is incomplete and just wasted my time and money. It was a very stressful experience dealing with them it felt like a con operation, they got your drives and data and they make you feel like you are their hostage if you don't pay them. will never use them again.

1 Check Yelp. Be careful. It may be a scam. The internet is full of highly negative comments and articles bordering in my opinion on criminal allegations. Their Better Business Bureau rating is F. I sent a 2 .5" hard drive which my computer could not recognize. This is typically a controller issue and the easiest failure to recover data.  He said there was a controller failure and the heads also "buckled". He said the could recover approximately 10,000 folders and 7,000 files.(he gave me a precise number I don't recall.)He said he was 100% sure this information could be recovered but the recovery would take 10 days. This made no sense since the only way they could be this sure is if they read the data so why didn't write to their server then. He became defensive and finally hung up when I asked for the disk to be sent back. My opinion: Criminal Enterprise. Most likely it was  trivial electronics problem and every else was BS. My opinion: avoid like the plaque.

Not sure if this was a misunderstanding or what, but all ended up being a total scam. The account manager and sales person I was dealing with told me that the recovery don't care about windows installation or software, but only photos, videos or other media which is what most people want to recover. I asked if she could ask engineers to tell me if there I any photo/image files, she got back to me and told me there were hundreds of pictures so I decided to move forward. I signed an agreement of "no refund under any circumstances" which I did believing that if I take the risk, at least must be something in there. For my surprise I only got windows installation files, and that's it. The only images found were from windows wallpapers. I'm so mad at this for the fact of the lie, if they just told me you have to take the risk, I wouldn't care that much. I felt awful and lost $960 US dollars. I asked and called them and never returned my call back. I don't trust them and you shouldn't either.

Review.Titre: Please don't try recovery in Fields…
Review.Contenu: Please don't try recovery in Fields Data Recovery.I paid $640 and waited for 6 weeks.I heard "Unfortunately Our processes were unsuccessful in recovering any data from your hard drive. Please accept our apologies that no recovery possible".And they just sent some images that show my hard drive and let me know "we will return your device ASAP".I don't know how people got their recovered data and give a good review.In my experience, don't choose to send the drive to 1010 Market Street, Suite 590, St. Louis, MO 63101.In initial diagnosis, he said he couldn't detect any visible damage except one part of it, so he suggested me to try repair the drive with new parts for a damaged part and I agreed with it. And now he said he couldn't recover because of more damage in the parts of my drive.In his summary, nothing will be recovered.Be careful with recovery rate that they inform.It doesn't mean anything with the real data recovery.So please don't try to waste your money and time!!!

When I told the guy that called that I couldn't justify taking $700 dollars from my family out of my teacher check to recover files that I could eventually waste my time and redo.  I was rudely cut off and asked how I wanted it returned, I said regular mail is fine.  What I must have forgot to tell him is that I also wanted it returned unbroken even more than it was (which it was only damaged on the inside, the bar that reads the data was broken).  I just received it in the mail and when I opened it up, the tower that I sent to them was literally in 4 pieces, broke, with the guts out of the tower flopping around in the box.  If anybody wants pictures just send me an email with TOWER RETURN as the title to : tmeusborn@yahoo As a teacher I don't make a lot of money but wanting to charge me $700 to get files that I was told by a tech guy that it should cost between $300 and $400 and then to disrespect my property like that WOW.  I'm sure all my files are definitely all gone now.  Thank for nothing Fields Data

Be warned!! They suck you in giving you a low estimate and pretending they care. They claim to be able to be the only ones that can repair your drive. They told me not even Seagate can do what they do. They are very attentive till they get your money. They don't guarantee their work but they tell you unless the drive is in a fire or smashed they should be able to recover your data.  Once they have your credit card you never hear from them again. Not only did thru not recover my data, they didn't have the decency to call me. After 4 weeks of waiting and calling, I finally got an email that they couldn't retrieve my data. They still haven't called.  I don't write reviews but I hate to see others get duped like I did. Now I will find every review site I can find to try and stop others from being duped. I'm starting to think this company is just a shell taking advantage of good people hoping to get back their memories. I’m sure they will just say I’m upset that I spent $800 and didn’t get my data back but it’s a lot more they that.

Review.Titre: My hard drive was permanently damaged…
Review.Contenu: My hard drive was permanently damaged by this company.  They fried the ROM chip and sent it back with a "What me worry?" and "Sorry, life sucks sometimes" response. They took no responsibility and I permanently lost photos I hadn't backed up at the time.  I had two other people look at it over the past two years and even the hard drives' manufacturer couldn't even start to recover any information.They dragged me along for months, careful not to email me as I could have used that information against them.   All communication (if communicated at all) was by phone, so it's just my words over theirs.  The British part of this company are much more professional.  When the second data recovery technician talked to one at a conference, they were appalled at the customer service I received, and tried to help me themselves, but my records were somehow unable to be located, even though it had only been a few months after my catastrophic experience with them.Avoid these scammers- they will try to sell you a fantasy but end up giving you a nightmare.

I sent my drive in to be reviewed.  Upon receipt, the rep said the drive was corrupt and they had to go through extra steps to get the data.  Upon pressure from the rep and discussion about his review of the condition of the hard drive, decided to move forward with getting some data.  I asked to get the drive back.  He said it was corrupt, but could send it back.  I received it about 25 days later.  Brought the computer in to get a new hard drive installed and the computer tech said the drive I sent in to Fields, was not corrupt and all the data pulled up right away with no issue.  He said the issue why I was having problems was because of a bad internal cable.  I contacted Fields to discuss the issue and they basically wanted nothing to do with working with me.  In essence, for being data recovery experts and conveying that a drive was corrupt and damaged when it was not, basically scaring a client into using their services, when the services were not really needed, is a bad business practice.  I would be very careful if you use this company.
Got my data back, but HD broke down in two months. Said they could not guarantee warranty for it. Then why sell it to me?
Unprofessional. Make false statements, fishing methods in marketing and highly intransparent! never again!!

I sent them my hard drive and they said it would be a free diagnostic. When my hard drive arrived there, they said I’d have to pay $200 for the diagnostic because they had to send the hard drive to a clean (specific) room to check it. They said that if it were unrecoverable I’d just lose that $200. After finding out that I’d have to pay for the “free” diagnostic I asked them to return my hard drive. After 3 days I sent them an email asking for the tracking number and they didn't answer my email. Later I called them and asked them if they had sent my hard drive back and they said no. I asked again if they could send it back to me and the guy said I’d have to wait about 2 weeks because they send all hard drives back in bulk so I’d have to wait until they had more to return. Then I asked him if it was possible to send it that day or the next and he said I’d have to pay $35 for express shipping. Final conclusion: They are scam company with little knowledge on hard drive recovery. I don't recommend them. They just want to get your money and after they will either say an expensive amount for recovery or that it’s unrecoverable.
They cannot do the job and they have terrible customer service. Never want to mention this company!

Review.Titre: Don't use them "D" rating on BBB
Review.Contenu: They told me on the phone that they were able to recover all my photos from 2010-2015, my music, and documents, so I paid them $825.   They sent the Zip drive to me.  I opened it clicked on the photos folder and was completely empty!   Being that the photos in my iPhoto's folder were the only thing that I had asked them to recover it was upsetting.   They tried to pull up the photos in my hard drive again and were unable to.  They said my $ was non refundable which is not fair Bc they told me they recovered my photos and was the only reason I paid.  To make things worse I sent my hard drive to another company who told me that Fields Data on their last attempt to recover my data must have caused the whole drive to Head crash which means it's completely crashed now.  So not only did they lie to me they actually made my drive fully crash.  Anyway I put a stop to the charge w Amex and am currently disputing it legally.    The manager wouldn't even call me back the last time I called in.   FYI I was very pleasant to deal with to them during the whole process and they were trying to avoid me.  Don't use them they have a "D" rating on the better business bureau.   Wish I saw that before

Review.Titre: For anyone who considers this as an option for data recover . . .
Review.Contenu: My experience fields-data-recovery.com 8-13-19I mailed in my hard drives, they gave me an accurate guess on when the drive would be returned. I got my footage back in a format that was unusable. As a professional wedding cinematographer, none of the footage was able to be opened or viewed at all.When I called again to see if there was anything else to be found on the drives. .  .They transferred my call twice(both representatives had bad customer service and acted like they didn't want to talk to me at all) and told me that I needed to mail in the hard drive they sent me with the unusable footage to process it any further.(This is the tenth time I have called to get this sorted out)Then Emily(the representative) put me on hold while I was mid sentence asking a question. 5 minutes later she returned and told me she had to talk to her manager and ignored my question about having my hard drives mailed back to me. She then proceeded to hang up. (She is my account manager)I am sharing this with you after we had purchased this data recovery option for $2400. If you are missing information, I highly recommend finding someone else to do it based on my experience so far(I still haven't hear anything back from the manager about having my personal hard drives mailed back to me).
Total scammers now holding my hard drive hostage. No replies to email or phone calls

Review.Titre: I strongly encourage anyone thinking of…
Review.Contenu: I strongly encourage anyone thinking of using the company not too. I paid them 600 hundred dollars to work a on flash drive in which like everyone else had valuable work information. After speaking to Dylan he assured me that about 90% of this kind of work was recoverable. After thinking about the price and the reward of having my work stuff back I decided to pay the 600 hundred dollars. Let’s not forget this guy named Dylan continued calling me to see if I had decided on the work to be done. After he reassured this kind of work was 90 percent success i paid the amount. About 2 weeks went by without hearing anything. When I called this so Dylan was always busy and never returned my calls. After about 3 weeks I continued to call and finally got in touch with Dylan. At this point all he could tell me is their engineers were still working on it. About 2 more weeks went by after numerous attempts to reach Dylan. He finally emailed saying nothing could be done. When questioned about a possible refund he never answered. I made numerous attempts to speak to their supervisor and he never would answer my calls even when he was there. I was not so bothered about paying the money but more offended on their lack of professionalism and their sincerity of  their work. I finally had to use legal matters just to be able to retrieve my flash drive back. Whoever reads this I hope you at least take in account my experience.
Drives were not repaired to recoverability, nor returned in non-static packaging.

Review.Titre: I have sent my Hard Drive to them and now they have my Hard Drive Hostage
Review.Contenu: I have sent my Hard Drive to them, they called me the next day, asking me if the Data on the Drive was important to me, prior in telling me if the drive is repairable or not. They contact me next day telling me that it will cost $3800, and I would need to pay it 100% upfront, with no documente, no quote, no terms&condition, no Guarantees. However they way they were forcing payment and acting, automatically raised RED FLAGS everywhere. They wanted payment right away, or lose chance of getting anything recovered. I felt my Drive was hostage by a set of scammers. I was on vacation at that time, and when I got back, I got an email from Mr. Schneblen that I have till Tuesday 2pm to pay. Well I sent them an email the next day telling them thanks for the diagnose but at this time I don't have the funds, however to sent me the drive back to the address provided. Mr. Schneblen then Threaten me to go after me for collection, and I have not even committed to anything. There was no documentation whatsoever over 3 weeks of communication, and now they have my hard drive hostage. I have written my last email given them 10 days to return my drive or I will need to engage my Lawyer to go after them. Clients beware. If someone does not sent you any formal proposal, quote, terms&Condition it is because something fishy is going on. I will be reporting back on August 15th of 2019, since this is the deadline they have to return back my drive.
Please do not give this company your business nor time. You have been warned!

Review.Titre: Failed to tell the truth about what they were doing and refused to refund my money.
Review.Contenu: Please note that this review is being made on the company as a whole and not just for the individual website fields-data-recovery,co,uk/, as fields-data-recovery,com and the UK version are essentially the same except for the change of contact information due to country of use. This review should be construed to apply to the company and not just each virtual sites.. I sent them a drive that had the click of death. After nearly 4 weeks of telling me that they would be able to recover my data on my 2TB external drive, they finally told me that they were seeing only corrupted data and could not recover any files. This is after they told me that they needed a sizable deposit so that they could order new "read heads". Once they sent me back my external hard drive I discovered that the case holding the drive had never been opened and the actual body of the drive was never even removed from the case and the manufacturer's warranty seal had never been broken or removed. I took the drive to the local county's school systems IT Supervisor who said that with the case never haven been open and the body never removed their was no way that FDR could have been able to change the "read heads". The local Sheriff's Department's IT and Forensics Data Recovery Investigator collaborated the school system's IT guy's opinion. FDR is claiming that the deposit was non-refundable but I am in the process of bringing criminal fraud charges against them.

I sent Fields data recovery a clients hard drive with these instructions. Take the data off this 250 gig hard drive. Put it on a new external usb hard drive . Then send me both drives back.Thats it. Let me know how much for this service.That way my client gets his data back and can use it as a backup drive for his other computers.  On the internet Fields advertising says 199.00 dollars for data recovery. They received my clients drive. I was given a quote of 400 dollars, then 800 dollars, plus an external usb hard drive would be an additional 90.00 dollars. I told them to just send the drive back. I will use a different data recovery service. I was then given a quote of 425.00 for everything, that means the data recovery and the new usb external hard drive. I agreed to it. I used paypal to pay the 425.00. I was sent a usb thumb  drive with my clients data in a  zip format. I told them where is the new external usb drive?Where is my clients original drive? Fields told me they didnt charge me for the new drive. I then told them you have my original request. We made an agreement of 425.00 for everything.They told me i would have to give them another 90 dollars  for a  new hard drive. I had enough of their money  goughing at this time. I then demanded the original drive back. It was sent a week later. Im not satisfied with Fields Data Recovery. I wouldnt recommend  their services to anyone else. I been in tech support and computer repair for 19 years . Never been deceived like this.

THIS IS A SCAM! DO NOT SEND YOUR COMPUTER OR PAY THEM. This is a company run by jerks. I sent them my Macbook Air, paid $700, and then within hours of paying, I was able to recover the files myself by logging into iCloud. A guy at their company named (name redacted) informed me that it costs so much because it takes 1-2 WEEKS of highly technical work in order to recover, so surely not much will have been done in a few hours. The following morning, (name redacted) told us that work had NOT yet started and that he would relay the message to stop work. When we called the following morning, all of a sudden, he became indignant and told us that it doesn't matter that we told him to stop because we already paid for the work. And plus they've already finished recovering all our data anyways. WHAT?! You slimy little scumbag. You never told them to stop the recovery? And wasn't it supposed to be 1-2 week turnaround time? I had to ask him 4 or 5 times for a manager before another dude named (2nd name redacted) came on the line. He was even more indignant towards me than (name redacted). He raised his voice and SCREAMED at me several times after I asked calm, rational, logical questions--trying to understand the timeline of what happened here. It was like what I imagine trying to rationally and logically discuss something with a sociopath would be like. (2nd name redacted) was unable to muster any sort of empathy or respect towards me. He was also unable and unwilling to see the situation from my point of view. He just kept rattling off unrelated metaphores that didn't apply at all to my case. He refused to address the fact that I was told initially that work hadn't started, and then the next day was told that it was finished and there would be no altering of the fee. I informed him I would be filing a police report and starting a dispute through my bank. He started yelling at me again so I hung up. DO NOT USE THIS COMPANY!!!!!

Do not trust this company. Communication was poor throughout my experience. Questionable charging/quoting practices. Not actually sure if they really did anything, or just took the money and sent me pictures of a disassembled drive.Sent a solid state drive in that was no longer detected by BIOS. They asked for $1600 up front, then $100 after the repair was done. I was able to "talk them down" (although I think they just grossly over-quoted to make me think I was getting a good deal) to $800 up front.After I sent my drive in, they performed "diagnostics" and said there was a 90% data recovery chance. After some time, they said they had to perform more advanced methods and that this method (something about connecting the drive to some board they have) had an 80% chance of data recovery.I received zero meaningful updates over a period of a month. I had to keep asking for status updates. Once I finally got a meaningful response, it was an email with pictures of the drive taken apart, a vague description (PDF report) of what was done to the drive, and a "Sorry, we couldn't do anything".Following this, I asked for some sort of refund on good faith. In their agreement, there is a line stating that they can refund partial or whole amounts at their discretion. I thought since they did not actually do anything for me, this would be no problem at least getting something back (I was willing to take the new hard drive they would have sent with my recovered data and be ok). That was not the case. After being instructed to fill out a "formal complaint", I was told I would have a response in 5-14 business days. Nearly three weeks later, I emailed the person who sent me the link to the "formal request" for an update. 5 days later, I finally received a response. The response essentially said "We did what we were obligated to do". No hope of any good faith with customers there.

Review.Titre: I have never had a worse experience …
Review.Contenu: I have never had a worse experience with a company. After sending my undamaged but unresponsive card in they told me that I needed to pay a $800 non-refundable fee to try and recover my data on an SD card. (nearly 3 times what I was originally quoted) They said they had a 50% success rate. (I was told over 90% on the phone) I decided to get my card returned to me. GETTING MY CARD BACK WAS A HOROR STORY. I paid $20 to have it shipped back to me quickly so I could get a different opinion from another company. I was told several times on the phone that it would be shipped out the next day and I would get a tracking number. The next day would come and go and no tracking number. It got the point where I was calling everyday. EXCUSES EVERY TIME. When it finally was returned the card was DESTROYED. It's Saturday now so I can't call and find out if opening the card is part of their evaluation process but certainly the card can be opened without breaking it apart. It was never communicated to me that my card would come back in pieces. I was also told that I would be getting a call about giving me a refund on my $20 shipping fee because my card was not sent back when promised. I'm still waiting on a call and a refund. I will be sending what's left of my card to the manufacturer's (Sandisk) recommended vender for data recovery and get them to look at it. Hopefully the destruction caused by the "professionals" at Fields Data hasn't caused my card to be unrecoverable. Don't make the mistake I did and trust this company with anything.Update on June 29th. After being told twice I would receive a call back about my refund Dan told me that I would receive a refund in up to two weeks. I will follow up on here to see if they keep their word.Update on July 8th. I received my refund for the $20 shipping. I still stand by my opinion of the company and would not use them. I sent my SD card to a company Sandisk recommended and it has been a great experience.

Review.Titre: Worst service on the planet. Period.
Review.Contenu: Beware: This company is the same as  Fields Data Recovery UK and their US website points to the UK Trust pilot account with false positive reviews. Two months ago I had one of the worst things happen. A failed hard drive. One that contained my entire music collection and photos from the past 15 years. All gone. I searched the web for data recovery services and happened to do the online estimate at Field Data Recovery. I was called by them later in the day about sending in my drive and I would know within 24-48 hours if they could retrieve my files from the drive. I never heard from them. I called and was told they were close and I should hear something within 24-48 hours from them. Still I never heard back from them. I figured they were working on it and gave them a week and called back. Once again they had no details and I was told I would hear from them in 24-48 hours. Never heard from them. I let another week pass and called again. I got the exact same response as I got the first two times. Yet again after the 24-48 I heard nothing. I gave them another week and called again. This time the person in charge of my drive was unavailable (in a meeting). The person answering the phones kept interrupting and cutting me off (I guess she did not want to hear me complain as I am sure they get a lot of that, but seriously how rude). I finally was able to ask to speak with a manager and he came on the phone, apologized, told me a little more about the condition of the drive and then once again told me I would hear something from them in 24-48 (it has been 24 hours and I don't believe that I will hear back from them tomorrow). Everything I have read about this company is telling me that they pull this crap and keep your files hostage so you pay exorbitant prices once they finally get back to you. Don't listen to them when they say 24-48 hours, as this is apparently 4 plus weeks for these guys. I have no confidence in this company to live up to any of their promises made on their site or on the phone. With the way they treated me and handled my case I would never, ever recommend that anyone use their services. Period. Go somewhere else.UPDATE: They are trying to have this review removed even though their own site points to these reviews. Try running an honest company showing honest reviews like this one. Apparently the UK and US are indeed the same company that is now trying to pull this crap off in Europe and Asia. The TrustPilot reviews on their website and facebook pages are false. Beware. After being jerked around for over a month I finally hear back and they are asking for $820. Not happening. I can't afford it and even if I could I would NOT give them any money with the way they treated me. I have asked to have my drive returned to me. But after reading more reviews (not associated with their bogus TrustPilot account) I feel I will never get the drive back either. Stay away from these people in all countries. Google them if you don't believe me. Wish I had done more research before trusting in TrustPilot and going down this road.

Review.Titre: Hands down the worst possible service I…
Review.Contenu: Hands down the worst possible service I could ever expect. My hard drive had a busted drive-head on a hard drive I stored research data on. When I first asked Fields for a turn-around time on a repair job for that, I was told it would take a week for my device to be looked at, repaired, and returned to me. I was also asked to source a blank identical drive for parts, if I could. I did. First things first: Every attempt to contact them by email failed to get a response until I'd sent at least three emails over the course of a week. Never did they respond sooner than a week after I'd sent an email. Every attempt to contact them by phone got me the run-around on hold until I was told a supervisor/manager would call me back. That never happened. Fields didn't get back to me with anything solid for three weeks, despite repeated attempts to contact them after a week had past. When they finally did, I was told they hadn't looked at it yet. Yet more weeks later, they finally got to it. Apparently. They said they couldn't use my spare drive and had to source their own, wanted me to pay for that. Then they gave me a file list which contained all of the folder but less than 1% of the files. Which should not have happened, because a busted drive-head doesn't cause significant drive damage. I don't know what they did to it, but they messed something up in a big way. There was still a tiny amount of data listed as retrieved though, so I grit my teeth and paid them to get the drive back. The drive, when returned yet more weeks later (10 weeks in total), despite repeated questions of "where is the drive you told me you were sending back?" When it finally arrived, it came with a USB drive which had my minuscule amount of retrieved data and no spare hard drive. Which I had explicitly and specifically asked in (at first ignored, but eventually responded to) emails if it would be returned to me. The USB had my folders, but as it turns out most of the "retrieved" files were corrupted and I couldn't get any data off of it. The returned 'repaired' drive was broken beyond repair and couldn't be reused. And the spare drive is still missing in action, presumably lost or just taken and not returned by Fields. At every step of the way communication was awful, nonexistent, and I was repeatedly lied to. And I know it may seem like I'm really upsetabout this and ... well that's because I am. I'm normally really accommodating about delays, problems, etc. from service companies. I've worked in the service industry myself, I get it. But this was outright malignantly bad service. There's no excuse for it. Oh and at one point when asking for a pay form I hadn't been given for the third time that week, I was sent a 'pay form' ... which was a .png of someone else's file tree. So add general incompetence to the list. If Fields actually did the work they promised and didn't just straight up remove and scan the hard drive outside a clean room (which I wouldn't rule out, it'd be consistent with the damage done), they're the worst data recovery service I've ever heard of. Never use them.

I contacted Fields Data Recovery regarding a laptop that had failed and used eMMC chip memory instead of a standard hard drive.  They were informed in both email and conversation that the issue was that the power supply on the mother board had failed and the computer used not a hard drive but eMMC chip memory.  The service I requested was a recovery of the files from the eMMC chip.  Fields assured me this was not a problem, that they did this all the time, and that such services start at, and usually cost $199.  They also stated that I would get a list of the files that could be recovered, and there would be no charge if no successful.  I shipped the unit to Fields and several days after shipping, contacted them as I had not heard from them.  After two phone conversations I received a call with a message from their engineers asking if we had removed the hard drive prior to shipping.   I explained again that there was no hard drive, it was an eMMC memory chip.I then got a call from them stating that the unit required a completely different procedure, that it was not at the right office for such a procedure (called a chip off) and that the procedure would cost $960 dollars, the bulk of which was payable in advance, was non refundable, and that there was no guarantee of success.Thus, I came to the following conclusions-	The personnel answering the phone had either ignored my statements about the eMMC chip storage or were ignorant as to what it was.  If they were ignorant, then they should have escalated the case to someone who understood.-	The engineers who worked on my computer ignored the case file notes.-	The engineers who worked on my computer could not recognize an eMMC storage system (note these are supposed to be top talent computer storage personnel).I also received a letter from them that did not accurately represent the issues, but rather said that the drive (again, no drive) needed to be sent to the R&D division, have parts procured and replaced, be put in a clean room, etc. etc. etc. none of which is part of the chip off procedure, or what I had been told on the phone.I asked for the laptop to be sent back to me, at which point I was told it would cost $60, and that there was no less expensive option.  This is at odds with their letter to me where they acknowledged that it was a laptop I was sending, and stated specifically that offered a free USPS return option should I not want to go forward.  When I paid the $60 the person who took my money could not tell me when the unit would ship.  When I did get my tracking number I found that it was shipped via UPS ground (despite being told in email that I would receive it that day – overnight) which at full retail cost was $11.04 (I am sure that as a large customer they have a substantial discount).  So it would appear that the rest of the money was a “fee” for them looking at the laptop, figuring out that it was what I told them, and telling me it would cost almost a $1000.00.   When we received the laptop back we found it had been packed in a random box, 10 times the size of the laptop, with a single layer of bubble wrap and no other packing so basically the laptop was loose in the box (note, it had been shipped in a padded, packed box made for laptops).  Additionally all the screws that were removed to open the unit had not been replaced.I have attempted to complain to Fields about some of these issues but their response has been to ignore my comments and rather attempt to place all blame on me for simply being unhappy with the price.  I am unhappy with the price.  I am more unhappy that I was mislead, that I feel this is bait and switch, that despite being given proper information it was ignored, that the letter to authorize work presented a false list, that I feel I was charged for it being examined, that I was told it was express shipping and it was not, that it was so poorly packed for return and the poor poor level of customer service.I would judge the practices of this company to be exceptionally deceptive.  Their strategy is to get the hardware and then convince you of the need to pay them.  And then when you say no and complain, they become hostile and uncooperative.

I was badly mislead by this company when they required $400 for repair parts before they could proceed with the job.  After sending them the money, I received an email that was exactly the same as another Trustpilot reviewer (26 Auyeung) received (see below).  Coincidence?  I don't think so.  I then sent the unit to DriverSavers, Inc. and they recovered all of the data.  Because DriverSavers was able to recover the data, and did so without ordering "replacement parts", I don't think that Fields Data Recovery actually did an evaluation of my drive or even order any parts.
