They made an easy $400, and they don't deserve even 1 star.Text of Email from Fields Data Recovery below: The data recovery laboratory received your hard drive and it was determined necessary to purchase parts to complete a head swap to attempt the recovery of your data. Using the newly sourced parts, our technicians performed diagnostic, repair and retrieval procedures on the disk in an attempt to recover the data and copy it to your chosen media. Unfortunately these processes were unsuccessful in recovering any data from your hard drive. Diagnostics The hard disk drive was disassembled in an ISO-4 standard clean air room so that its internal components could be individually tested. The electronics PCB board, (which is responsible for all communication between the computer and the mechanical parts of the disk), was isolated and tested for damage to the fuse, transistors/capacitors, circuitry and interface and all were found to be in working order. The disk was connected to an analysis machine and the ROM/firmware (a table of instructions found on the disk which allow computers to interpret the disks signals properly) was directly accessed and found to be in working order. The magnetic plates (platters) were isolated and examined for signs of irreparable damage and none could be seen on the accessible sides of the platters. The read/write heads (which span the magnetic platters and read the data) were isolated and examined where damage to the arm and magnetic reader was revealed; furthermore when power was supplied to the disk the read/write head(s) were found not to be positioned within the correct alignment. However, additional tests on the motor (the component responsible for spinning the platters) found it to be in working order. Repairs  The damage to read/write heads was most probably caused by the misaligned positioning of the head assembly when the hard drive was not powered. In addition to this small pieces of dirt and dust were detected on the individual reader heads. The actuator arm and read/write heads were chemically cleaned and re-examined to maximize the chance of re-alignment. The arm was then mechanically altered to prevent further alignment problems and the read/write heads were re-assembled on to the disk. Unfortunately, subsequent diagnostics confirmed that the repairs made were unsuccessful.An identical hard disk was sourced and subsequently ordered and used for spare parts in order to attempt the recovery of your data. The read/write heads were completely removed from the newly ordered disk and were examined to ensure they were in working order. This second set of read/write heads were then assembled into the original disk replacing the existing malfunctioned heads and carefully aligned. Diagnostics confirmed that this procedure was also unsuccessful. Further analysis of the medias platter surface revealed inconsistencies of the magnetic properties which could potentially be linked to the contact made between the head and platter surface resulting from the initial ‘head crash’. This may have been caused by one of several factors ranging from environmental impacts (e.g. a drop or bang) up to temperature expansion of certain components. Due to this preventative damage caused we were unable to initialise the heads long enough for a forensic scan to take place before further damage was caused to the replacement read/write heads.Conclusion: No recovery possible.Unfortunately, as we are unable to help with your data recovery needs at present, there is no further action that can be made.

They somehow have great reviews listed on their website, but you should check other review sources for the truth. Here's my experience own experience:Synopsis:  I accidentally sent them a working external hard drive instead of a broken one, and they quoted me $940 to "fix" it. Then after the headache that followed, they finally returned it to me... in multiple pieces. Details: I had a hard drive that had dropped onto the floor, and wasn't reading in my computer. I had a second identical drive as a backup, but I had lazily forgotten to back it up since the start of 2017. I currently live overseas, and was quoted $1500usd for data recovery in Hong Kong for my broken drive. I thought I would check for a better rate while I was home in the US in early April. I contacted Fields Data Recovery by phone and explained the situation. The sales person was (of course) extremely pleasant and helpful. He said that he was confident they could do the recovery for cheaper, starting as low as $400, and that they could get the replacement drive back to me within two weeks (before I returned to Hong Kong). There would be a free diagnosis, followed by a price quote, and then I would decide whether to move forward with data recovery for that price. That was fairly identical to my experience with the Hong Kong company.I sent it in same-day, and quickly received email confirmation of the drive's delivery. Soon after that, I was provide with some vague diagnostic about firmware and a price for retrieval of $940.The first thing I thought was that diagnosis description was very vague and not much like the one I had received from the Hong Kong company. Second, the price seemed a bit higher than the sales call had led me to believe, but cheaper than the Hong Kong quote, and I thought maybe that was on purpose, and I shouldn't have told them what I was quoted originally, but that's business.Then I reviewed the list of recovered files, and I immediately realized that I had sent them the wrong hard drive -- it had all of the files up through 2016 but nothing after. I quickly called my husband to test the other drive and he confirmed what I thought: instead of the broken one, I had accidentally sent in the working (backup) hard drive. This was my mistake. But in making this mistake, I realized that they were willing to charge me almost $1000 to "fix" a working hard drive. It made me wonder if they do this to other people, who might not realize they are being grossly overcharged.What followed turned into a bit of a nightmare. I immediately contacted my Account Manager, and explained that I had sent in the wrong drive, that the drive they had was in fine working order, and I needed that drive returned. I asked him to please let me know if there would be any issues returning the drive before my departure date.He replied that it would take a few weeks to get the drive into my hands. (This was different then what I was told originally). After that, he became very non-responsive, unhelpful, and dismissive. At one point, he offered to do the data recovery for $400 instead of $940. I declined, reminding him that the drive they had worked fine, so there was no need for recovery services, and I asked him to confirm that I would receive the drive in the same condition it arrived in (which is what I experienced with the Hong Kong company). It ended up being two months, a few dozen emails and more than a few headaches before the drives were finally delivered to a family member in the US. When the package was opened, the "working" hard drive I sent them on mistake was in multiple pieces. This is when I found all of the horror stories online -- not only from the US but from their "branches" in the UK, Germany, and more. I should have researched the company better, and I probably would have under usual circumstances. I was lucky, in a way, because I didn't lose any money, but now I have one broken hard drive, another possibly broken one, and a decade's worth of precious data, memories, photos and work possibly lost forever. I'm surprise that a company like this exists in America today, and I hope this review will keep someone from being hurt by it.

Review.Titre: I'm so disappointed of the service what …
Review.Contenu: I'm so disappointed of the service what I'm dealing with "James Gamblin" (Account Manager), at the beginning has been told ,the Diagnostics have completed , At this point we cannot say for certain what data is recoverable, but well over half of similar attempts result in a complete, and full recovery. and we discuss the price from $913 down to $640, up-front payment ($400) which is paid. from Sep. 7th, been told "It is currently imaging at 54%. If all goes well, then we should hit 100% and have a file list for you", on the Sep. 20th :"It is at 81%. If everything goes smoothly within the drive, then we should get a full image", and then I email on the Oct 2nd, James respond back on Oct 4th with message "Sorry, was out of the office until today. It's keeps dropping out around 92%, because of the bad sectors within the drive. Engineers had to take it back to the clean room to readjust firmware issues to hopefully try and get around those sectors at 92%, so we can get a full image. As we have to get a full image to get any data off of here. "and he's disappear until I keep email him from Oct 22nd to Oct 26th, he finally reply me back with message :Hello, The data recovery laboratory received your hard drive and it was determined necessary to purchase parts to complete a head swap to attempt the recovery of your data. However, additional tests on the motor (the component responsible for spinning the platters) found it to be in working order. Repairs The damage to read/write heads was most probably caused by the misaligned positioning of the head assembly when the hard drive was not powered. In addition to this small pieces of dirt and dust were detected on the individual reader heads. The actuator arm and read/write heads were chemically cleaned and re-examined to maximize the chance of re-alignment. The arm was then mechanically altered to prevent further alignment problems and the read/write heads were re-assembled on to the disk. Unfortunately, subsequent diagnostics confirmed that the repairs made were unsuccessful. An identical hard disk was sourced and subsequently ordered and used for spare parts in order to attempt the recovery of your data. The read/write heads were completely removed from the newly ordered disk and were examined to ensure they were in working order. This second set of read/write heads were then assembled into the original disk replacing the existing malfunctioned heads and carefully aligned. Diagnostics confirmed that this procedure was also unsuccessful.Further analysis of the medias platter surface revealed inconsistencies of the magnetic properties which could potentially be linked to the contact made between the head and platter surface resulting from the initial ‘head crash’. This may have been caused by one of several factors ranging from environmental impacts (e.g. a drop or bang) up to temperature expansion of certain components. Due to this preventative damage caused we were unable to initialize the heads long enough for a forensic scan to finish before further damage was caused to the replacement read/write heads. Unfortunately, as we are unable to help with your data recovery needs at present, there is no further action that can be made. With regard to your media, we will happily return to you at your request, or dispose of it in an environmentally friendly manner. Please email me what you would like us to do with your drive.James Gamblin Account Manager"that's not a good business to dealing with. don't attract customer to collect their money and then holding time then abandon away. customer will sue your company with law suit.

Review.Titre: The Missouri Attorney General should shut Fields DOWN!!!
Review.Contenu: To better grasp the severity of the Fields Data Recovery SCAM, it is important to remember that this document was composed on Wednesday, August 9, 2017. I will be very specific with the dates of my communication with Fields Data Recovery so that you will better understand the outrageous arrogance of their sales representatives. The reason I am composing a thoroughly detailed report of this exchange is to assure you that I am not a crank who looks to smear companies because I’ve got too much time on my hands. I am 56 years old and have no desire to ruin an innocent employee's life. I've been there. What I have included is the absolute truth, and you should regard any 5-star review for Fields to be suspect. If Fields is so wonderful, why do so many people have the same experience I had? Google "Fields Data Recovery Scam" and see what comes up!In my initial contact with Fields, I was assured they were “the second largest data recovery firm in the U.S.” I am assured I am dealing with a group of complete professionals.To cut right to the chase before I get into details, on Wednesday, April 19, 2017, I mailed to Field’s the hard drive from my PC that had crashed the previous October along with a brand new Toshiba Canvio Basics 1T external hard drive I had purchased for $55 on Amazon for the recovered data. The data on my crashed HD represents over four years of work I had done on my PC. Additionally, I paid $400 for the recovered data I never received after a period of over SIXTEEN WEEKS!! I consider everything to be lost, will report the $400 as an act of fraud to my issuing bank, and will be reporting Field’s to the Attorney General in Missouri. I kept all email communication in a folder on my PC, so every single word quoted is 100% accurate. If they try to sue me, I’ll bring it all to court!Timeline and Text of CommunicationTuesday, April 18	I received an email from Fields containing the text below and two .pdf documents (one a UPS shipping label, and the other a form I had to fill out identifying my hard drive and the specifics of what I wanted done). I carefully packaged my materials wrapped in bubble wrap and shipped it the next day, April 19. The email was an introduction to Fields and what they do. Note the following:As discussed, we can offer you a free diagnostic which would mean getting a report on any faults - usually within 24 hours, an online file list of any recoverable files and a fixed price quote. You don't have to accept the quote and if you don't then I would be able to arrange to send your Media back to you (we have a free USPS option).Wednesday, April 19		I received the following email, along with two .pdf documents (one the Fields Terms & Conditions Agreement, and the other their policy about returning crashed hard drives). Here is the substance of the email:Re: Data Recovery - Job Number 727905I would like to take this opportunity to welcome you to Fields Data Recovery. We are pleased that you have chosen to use us to help you with your data recovery needs. We can confirm that we have received your hard drive and it has already been entered for a diagnostic analysis. The exact service level will have been agreed with your account manager who is at hand to help you if you have any concerns.Tuesday, April 25	I received the following email from Fields:Hi Kevin,We have recently finished backing up your data. We are happy to say the recovery was very successful. We were able to work through bad sectors, head swap and slow responding problem which was resolved. The price to get your data back to you will cost $1,230. We do have a same day discount, which would bring your total $1115 (Same day discount is for individuals who purchase their data the same day its recovered). Contact me when your get a chance. Thank you!!I sent the following email:While I am very pleased to learn my data is recoverable, I am electing to have my hard drives returned without the data backed up, per your "no obligation quote." The data simply is not worth the quoted price of $1,230. Thank you for your help in this.That same day I received another email, stating that a local recovery service would be willing to perform the recovery for $960. Again, I declined, as my initial research into data recovery services uncovered numerous services at estimates of $300 to $500.A few hours after I declined the second estimate and requested the return of my two hard drives, I received an email:No problem Kevin.Now, here’s where things start to reveal the SCAM that is Fields Recovery!Wednesday, May 10		Fifteen days after Fields agrees to return my two hard drives, he sends me this email:Kevin, I want to apologize for our shipping department not getting your device out to you yet. For the inconvenience, we can get you your data back to you for $400. We plan on getting it back to you very soon. Feel free to touch base with me when you get a moment. Again, I apologize for the delay.  Okay, we’ve gone from $1,230 down to $400 just to apologize for the two-week delay at their shipping department! Remember, there are no data recovery outfits that assure you of a set price before they take your hard drive (there is no way they can promise a successful recovery until they know what caused the HD failure). So once they recover the data, all the work is done. If you don’t accept their price, that means all their work is for nothing. Anyway, I was delighted with the significant reduction, and since $400 is well within my budget, I accept the offerFriday, May 12	I telephone Fields and pay $400 with my credit card.Wednesday, May 24		Fields sends me an update on my order:Good Kevin,It appears that there was an update this morning by shipping by you are in line your shipment. As I write this, it is Wednesday, August 9, seventy-seven days after my account manager notifies me that my order is being prepared to ship. SEVENTY-SEVEN DAYS!!!Friday, June 23	It is now thirty-nine days since I was told the shipping department was on the cusp of sending my order. Nobody in the shipping department responds to my communications. Frankly, I am livid. I telephone Fields and told him in no uncertain terms if I don’t have my order delivered in the next seven days, I’m going to savage Fields Data Recovery like a bad case of HIV on every social media platform I can find. Once I make that statement, I hung up the phone. I am finished listening to the lies of my "account manager."I have been completely civil and professional in all my communications with Fields Data Recovery, but I am at my wit’s end. It is clear that my assurance of an imminent shipment was a lie, and for all I know, no data recovery was ever performed.Two hours after I make that phone call, my acct manager copies me on an email to the shipping department:Please get his original back. He says he is going to bash us on social media if he does not receive it by next week.He then sends me the following:Kevin,I took $400 dollars for data recovery. As I am not in the shipping department, or have anything to do with them. It personally isn't my fault he didn't send your original back to you, but I understand that you are upset that you need it back. I don't think trying to stirring things up with me is going to do you any good, because I am the one hounding shipping for not getting out to you.This is the last communication between myself and Fields. Please note the utterly tone-deaf statement this guy makes.“I don't think trying to stirring things up with me is going to do you any good, because I am the one hounding shipping for not getting out to you.”Yeah, you’ve been a priceless help in that department! You’re entrusted to act as sales rep for the company, but some chimpanzee high school dropout in the shipping department still has a job with “the second largest data recovery firm in the U.S.” CONCLUSIONAnd there are the facts of my experience with Fields. I can swear in court to the 100% accuracy of what I have written. I hold no hope whatsoever that I will ever see my data or hard drives ever again. But if I can put a dent in Field’s business stream, I fully intend to. If anyone reading this needs data recovery, for the love of God, DON’T GO TO FIELDS!I now have no fewer than three cloud auto-backup services (Evernote, Dropbox and Microsoft OneDrive). If my hard drive crashes again, I will NOT go through this ever again!Update 8/11/17: After sending this excoriation of Fields Data Recovery to social media AND reporting the transaction to my bank, I receive an email from UPS: You have a package en route to you from Fields Data Recovery.This is the HELL you need endure when dealing with Fields Data Recovery! CHOOSE WISELY!
They charged $1140,  rebuilt the drive after two months. No data recovered. Why charge so much for such low results.

The drive was sent to Fields but after 1 day of its arrival the tech/rep started calling and emailing incessantly. The total calls in 1 day was 7 with 9 emails in 2 days.  Including an email threatening to "destroy" the drive if I did not respond.  The data was recovered and returned but the threat of data destruction because i did not respond fast enough was over the top. Will find a different service in the future.

Review.Titre: The POOR rating is given because of the…
Review.Contenu: The POOR rating is given because of the cost. I had a full SanDisk 32GB card for my camera which wouldn't load into a reader anymore. I searched and found Fields-Data- Recovery. Quick and easy, send it to us and we'll tell you what it costs. Between $1050 and $950 I was told after they recd. my card. I was shocked at the cost, after having my MacMini's hard drive recovered from another source, for about the same money. Their policy says that if you don't like the price to recover, they'll send it back. The hairs on the back of my neck stood up, but I paid the $950.00 to recover the photo files anyway. I recd. my recovered files on a 32GB Stick. Thanks, but not happy with price. After the fact I researched the company on the BBB / Better Business Bureau site. You should do this first. It's my fault I paid the money. Not a SCAM, but SKETCHY!

They did not even try to recover anything from my applications folder, and, when I sent them a message about it, they did not reply.  That was more than two months ago.  The price was also very, very high.They also rushed me on making a decision.  When I told them that I wouldn’t have time to review the list of files they were able to recover, I got a very hard-sell campaign to make a decision NOW!!!I imagine that their technical staff is very good.

Review.Titre: Slow Service, didn't recover much data.
Review.Contenu: The service took from early February till the end of May.  I was transferred to different associates over the duration and given different stories.  The heads failed and additional money was required to try a second attempt.  There are other companies that do not charge if they do not get your data.  I also suspect that the drives are sent to another country to have services  done.  The service took way too long.  There are other services out there.

The people at Fields Data Recovery were great to work with but unfortunately none of the native work files were recovered from my drive. The only files that were recovered were links to those work job files. Anything that was originally a layout program file like Quark, Indesign or Illustrator came back as a Unix format. I work on a MAC so not sure why this happened. I paid too much for a bunch of links to jobs that i have to track down from printers or rebuild.

Review.Titre: Deceptive business practices - I don't recommend Field Data Recovery
Review.Contenu: Like many data recovery services, they will estimate retrieval costs on the low end and then give you a price that is almost twice the estimate once they have your disc. Secondly, I chose them for their nearby US location, but found out my disc left the country and my data was being shipped back from the U.K. without being disclosed to me.  Lastly, they promised an "average turn around time of 48 hours." Now going on 2 weeks and do not have my data back yet. No followup. I had to call and email several times for a reply.

Pressured me to quickly accept "reduced price" back burner data recovery, supposedly to be done whenever the techs had extra time over the next several weeks.  Once I accepted, data was shipped next day, suggesting the recovery was already done.  Little useful data was recovered.  When I told them about this, they went back and captured another 90G of data in a couple of days.  My assumption was that they would get all the data they could the first time, not just the easy data they could ship out the next day.  Still missing vast amounts of data, which makes me wonder what else they could have recovered with additional effort.

Review.Titre: They might be technically competent but…
Review.Contenu: They might be technically competent but logistics are poor. I'll skip the details as my experience is much like everyone else. Bottom line, it took 2 full months from when they received my drive until I received it back. They quoted $500 up front to buy an identical drive for parts, then $300 to perhaps retrieve data. I declined.Be advised: If you call them, they will send a prepaid shipping label to send in your drive.You have 28 days from when they receive your drive to request it be returned.If you pay for them to retrieve your data you have already agreed that you are completely satisfied with their service.

The office was close to our operation, and the company and web site gave your the feeling that they would be quick at performing their service,  they were not.   Gave approval to do the recovery on Monday, promised it would be done on Wednesday, was not. Was then promised for Friday. On Thursday i asked to pick up whatever was done.  They said they call back on friday with detail.  no call.  i called on friday, not done, no partial available.   called on Monday  AM  not done. Finally they called monday afternoon and said it was done.  picked up late monday afternoon .   the data recovered was acceptable.

Review.Pseudo: At Least I Got My Data
Review.Contenu: Sent in my hard drive for the free check about what was wrong with it. It ended up costing $900 to get the data off and I had read that ever getting your drive back if you didn't go with them was really hard. So I paid $900 and they did get everything on the original drive. I needed that data and got it, but the cost seemed way too high and I don't know that it should have been that costly.I put a label on my original drive with all my contact info specifically saying I needed that hard drive back. I even created a contract that the company contact approved that specifically said I would get my original drive back, but it still took 3 emails that were never answered and wasn't until a company guy called asking for a good review that I finally got my original drive back.

It took a very long time, it cost twice what was quoted over $800 total, I had to constantly call for information, I did not receive any timely updates. I received the finished product, and  it only had a third of the data in the form of photos thay had said was recovered. I had sent in a brand new 1TB hard drive and was told after waiting weeks that they were waiting for me to buy from you or provide a new drive, when I explained it had been sent in with the defective drive I was told "oh ok let me look" Not very satidfied and should be refunded between $200 & $400 dollars, Original quote was for $400 either honor that or split the difference and return to me $200. Not satisfied at all. Still not sure if i ever got the complete amount of data that was recovered.

It might be a good company, but they have the worst customer service; I have a place in order in March, and I been calling everyone month few times, and the only update that I get is they need to order parts. Finally, I called today, and as per the guy who answers the phone, notifies me that the job was completed since July 9, and no data recovery, and I still haven't got a phone call from them, and I been calling even in July and they didn't inform me of a complete job. I express that to him, he was I'm reading what it says, he was rude because he was for the 4th time, there is no data. Meanwhile, I paid $974 for the service for someone to tell me that no data recovery and the person who did it is no longer with the company. I even asked if there is nothing else to be done, and that is when he told me "for the fourth time, the job was completed and no data was recovered," and with that, I ask him to send my driver back. I must say that the company needs better customer service people and they should offer other recovery options, technology keeps evolving.

My hard drive failed so I contacted this company only on the base of some positive reviews I read on this website. During the initial phone conversation they told me that the office was in London but when I went to deliver the hard drive I discovered that they were based in Wales. I was nervous about sending it by courier as it could have been further damaged and it would have taken 2 days just to reach their office but decided to send it. During the same conversation they estimated a cost of £200 then two days later they phoned me to inform that the recovery would have been more than £800 but in the email with final assessment it was £595. I thought it was still exorbitant and the amount fluctuating so much felt dishonest so I asked to send the hard drive back by DHL to the same office where I delivered it; it took 3 days to arrive even if the courier travels daily. I had to trace the delivery all day and when I went to collect the hard drive the USB cable was missing, not even an "I am sorry". I wasted 10 days, haven't solved the problem only accumulated tiredness and stress.
Over priced. Got back 1/8 of data. And very poor callback time. Was told.1 week. Heard back 4 weeks later.

Review.Titre: confused as to wether things are done.
Review.Contenu: confused as to wether things are done.Good to and from instructions

The recovery was fine - very expensive. Only after I paid did I see a number of people from online reviews say that their price was significantly cheaper when they griped about the sticker price. Live and learn.

A lot of data that I requested to not be pulled got pulled and a lot of date was pulled twice amounting to over a terabyte of data.  I deleted over half of it due to it being most of it being data pulled twice and data I didn't request to be pulled

Review.Titre: A majority of data was retrieved, But...
Review.Contenu: A majority of data was retrieved, but the most important data with legal implications was not retrieved. There was a suggestion that if I paid more they might be able to get it but no guarantee. After spending $1,000 I wasn't willing to throw more money at the problem

I was originally quoted a price of about $1800 because I had a Raid-0 twin drive, but I worked with them and had the data recovery done for about half that.  I was worried because of the reviews, but all of my data except my Microsoft Outlook files and Microsoft OneNote files were recovered.  I really hated losing my email contacts especially.  However, I was certainly glad to get all of my documents, photos, etc.

I was unable to get a 2TB external hard drive to start up.  I contacted Fields Data for help.  They quoted me a range of possible cost, which seemed high.  They encouraged me to send it in. It still seemed high.  I finally decided to let them fix it. They did recover the data. I received a smaller replacement drive smaller size, but data was recovered successfully.  Good service, but too costly.

Review.Titre: Make sure to ask for the file list!!
Review.Contenu: Got my drive repaired for a lot cheaper than other places. They said it would be a full recovery. They sent a new drive with recovered data, but lots of data was missing. Luckily, I asked to have the original drive sent also and it had all of the data on it. Emails are very slow to be responded to and customer service is not responsive at all. Make sure to ask for a file list BEFORE YOU PAY!!!

Review.Titre: After committing to my data recovery
Review.Contenu: After committing to my data recovery, this firm was slow and almost non existent with further information as to when and how long it would take to receive the data back in my office.They did a fine job of recovery and I am  grateful and thankful for that.Better communication on their part would have made this transaction a five star experience not just three.Would I use them again, not sure the answer is yes but maybe?

Experience was good overall.  I thought for the small amount of data it was a bit over priced for a non commercial recovery but not too bad.  I was a little annoyed that there was no one available in the evening hours (even though a real person answered the phone) to walk me through opening up the files on the new hard drive. I did however figure it out on my own.

Review.Titre: Only about half the data recovered, but I got the family pictures which my goal.
Review.Contenu: I thought the fees charged were higher than originally quoted.  I was told that the effort was more involved but a 7X increase was originally offered, and I was willing to walk away.  There were a lot of empty folders once the media was obtained.  There were many titled folders (which was encouraging), but they were empty when trying to open them.  Did they just stop short of recovering the actual data?

Review.Titre: Extremely pricier and took much longer than quoted over phone.
Review.Contenu: Provided adequate service, extremely pricier than quoted over phone. Other than that they did a great job.  Job was also delayed longer than quoted, by about a week.  This was for a business client. The original quote was under $500.  It was well over $1,000.  The time quote was, if you get it mailed in before Friday, we can have it in the mail by Monday, it took over a week.

Besides the cost, and I know how equipment and technology cost are high, the only concerns were that I had to make a few calls to find out what progress was being made and kept getting told that the person who was working on my data could not come to the phone.  Always said they would have them return the call but never did.  All of a sudden I received my data (flash drive) in the mail. It also took longer than I expected to receive my data. But I did receive all the important data that I needed.

Review.Titre: Not sure yet if it was worth it.
Review.Contenu: Eventually did all that was promised but it took longer than expected and seemed expensive for what I needed.  I had periods of time here communication was lacking.  At this point I do not know if my data was actually recovered.  There is no folder structure remaining and with thousands and thousands of unnamed files to look at and reorganize I am sure it will take me months to determine what I have and don't have.  Wish they had been more upfront on that item.

They state that they will provide you with a list of files before requiring payment, but that is not true.  I received a PHONE CALL stating that they had to order a part to so I had to pay $400 up front and it was non refundable.About two weeks later I received an EMAIL stating that they were unable to recover the data.There advertisement says: Receive a file list, report and fixed-fee quote before proceeding! Shame on me for falling for this...I should never have given them the $400 upfront.

Great product/result, but took many phone calls to get them to complete it and mail it back.  Took much longer than I expected because after the first phone call I understood it was going to be done in a day or two and shipped back.  Took longer with many followup calls.  However the final product was very good.

Review.Titre: Expensive and not all data recovered
Review.Contenu: I liked that they gave a free estimate of the work. However, the final price was over $200 more than quoted. Took 2.5 weeks for the turnaround, which was longer than expected. They said they recovered most of the data, however there are quite a few files missing. The Lost & Found folders that were supposed to hold some lost files are either empty or have unidentifiable useless files. Overall, I'm happy that I got a bunch of my stuff back, but the price tag is stiff and I still have lost data.

Service calls were very good and they did recover my data as promised. They also told me how much data was going to be recovered prior to me agreeing to the pricing. The pricing is expensive, don't be fooled by the standard recovery fee. Expect to pay 3 to 4 times more. They stated that they had to use parts from another drive to recover my data. I had asked that my old drive be returned, it was not, so there is no way to know if they had to rebuild the drive to get it to work. My data was on a 1.5 TB drive and I got a 1 TB drive in return which was mostly full with the data.

A little expensive, but they were also the fastest and were able to recover all of the data needed.I kind of feel they increased the price once they found out how much I wanted the files back.All in all, it was a necessary expense which recouped my files.

Review.Titre: Good but communication can be improved.
Review.Contenu: I've used this company twice. Overall results were good, but communications can be improved upon. It's a 50-50 shot whether you can get someone on the phone (Todd).I'm not sure why my disk had to go to the UK for data recovery. Just those few things seem to catch my attention.Thanks.

I probably should give more than 3 stars as they got 98% of my data back but I felt a bit like I was taken on pricing. Speaking with the tech initially gave me an idea of a price. When the cost came back over 3x that I was quite surprised. So for me it was 3 stars.

Poor communications.  Have not received response to my last email.  That was several months ago. The email concerned a new drive which I sent along Seagate drive which you sell.  No Whereabouts of my new drive.  Frankly, data recovered was not worth the price. Disappointed.

Review.Titre: I'd like to say that my overall …
Review.Contenu: I'd like to say that my overall experience was decent, but I just didn't like the fact that I payed as much money as I did and still have a lot of files missing or just don't seem to work for some reason. And i can't help but to feel like it didn't take the technicians a lot of work to get whatever back running they did do, just to tell me that it was all they could do for me after paying like over $500. But my experience was not a complete disaster, because the actual service of replacing my hard drive and delivery process wasn't all that bad.

Review.Titre: A power surge disabled the external …
Review.Contenu: A power surge disabled the external drive's ability to rotate.  There was about 300GB of pictures on the drive.   Fields Data Recovery was able to recover about 75% of the pictures without any data loss.  The other 25% of the pictures had some pixilation, data loss at the bottom of the photo (e.g., 30% of the bottom of the photo was missing).  Customer service and ease of use was excellent.  Cost of the service is expensive.  Not guaranteed to get all your files back.   Lower cost service or higher success rate on file recovery would have given them a 4 or 5 star rating.

Review.Titre: We got out data back... BUT
Review.Contenu: We got out data back, but it took about two months for them to "order parts"  and then once they had the data recovered it took 8 days to overnight us the data on a new hard drive.  I'm glad we got the data back but it was certainly a hassle.

Review.Titre: I got my data, but not in a hurry
Review.Contenu: The people are good and they were able to provide my data (great). But they take days to get back and make promises they don't keep.I wasn't really in a hurry, but I don't like being told it will be done in one day then have to chase them for a week.

Field-DataRecovery.com did a great job. For a first time client I wish they’d communicated more effectively in getting the completed project back to me. It took lots of running around with phone calls and emails to get things back.

External hard drive -- Bottom line, they eventually recovered my data.  However, the first time I sent off my drive and got it back, it was not recovered at all, and it was devastating.  Less than 1% of the pix/videos were able to be opened, many of the filenames were swapped, metadata was lost (date picture taken, etc) and I was very upset.  I was finally able to talk the customer service rep into taking back the drive and trying to recover it again, and eventually he did.  The second time, everything, as far as I could tell was recovered completely.  This was a LOT of stress for me that lasted months, but it ended well.  Paid over $835 for the operation.  1 star for Round 1, 5 stars for Round 2, Average is 3 stars.

Great customer service, a little disappointed that for the price not more data could be recovered (80%), specially some important folders. But i guess that how it is. Overall happy to have some files back.

Review.Titre: wide gap between initial estimate and final price
Review.Contenu: The initial estimate on the cost of service was very low but after the media was turned in we got a much higher (admittedly more realistic) price.  There also could have been more of an effort to provide updates.

Company did the job they said they would do, within the price range quoted. Took longer than expected and communication on follow up was poor, I had to call repeatedly to monitor the progress of my drive.

Review.Titre: They mostly recovered all of the data on the broken Drive
Review.Contenu: I had an old internal Laptop HDD that failed and could no longer be recognized. They were able to recovery the entire drive.I had one Outlook .pst that seems to be corrupted and cannot retrieve emails from, but everything else is opening as normal. I only give them a 3 star because in order to send me the data back they were going to load it onto a new external HDD and ship it back due to the large file size.  They told me I would have the drive in hand the beginning of the next week.  On Friday when I had not yet received the drive I called them and they told me they were out of external drives to use to ship the data back on and they were waiting on a shipment to come in the middle of the next week.  I would have appreciated a heads up!

Review.Titre: OK  the service was top notch
Review.Contenu: OK  the service was top notch,  but the price was way high   I have 3 more drives I want data from but at that price I need lottery winnings to get them done

Dealing with Cass and deciding to get the disk recovered seemed to go well.  After agreeing to the recovery and paying for it Cass told me it might be available by the next day but it might take two or three days.  He said I would get an email with instructions to access the data when it was ready.  Over a week later when I had not heard anything I called back.  Cass was surprised to hear I had not received anything and sent me the email he said I should have already received.  That email did not include the address of the ftp server I needed to access.  When I pointed that out he ran out of guesses and transferred me to Customer Service.  Later they sent me what appeared to be the information I needed but the data on the server it sent me to was not my data.  A couple of emails and telephone calls and days later I finally got the information I needed to access my data.

Review.Titre: I would to thank Fields Data Recovery…
Review.Contenu: I would to thank Fields Data Recovery because they they did an excellent job. I think it was a little overprice, but I learned my lesson.

Review.Titre: Should have had a backup but Fields helped recover some of my lost files.
Review.Contenu: A year ago I had an external drive that failed. I contacted another recovery site but their charges were more than I could pay. When the drive was returned to me I reached out to Fields Data Recovery and sent them my drive. There was a period of some confusion because I thought I was working with a different tech who I had spoken to on the phone. They explained exactly what was needed to recover data and in response to my concern about the cost reduced their fee. It still is an expensive lesson--always have a backup to avoid having to use their services. Eventually, I received a thumb drive with my recovered files. Unfortunately, not all files were recovered. They did not promise they would be able to restore 100% of the drive but I believe they did their best. Of the two companies I contacted, I would use Fields Data Recovery again, if needed. My only regret is that I didn't have a backup of the external drive and to get files I didn't want to lose I had to use their service. I would have rated them a four or five if I hadn't had the confusion at the beginning and if I had received 100% of my files, but some of that was out of their control and mine.
The service was okay but was promised shipping next day and it took an extra week to get my data back.

Review.Titre: Took a while to respond to my calls but …
Review.Contenu: Took a while to respond to my calls but they did a great job on getting back my data

Review.Titre: Cost was much higher than expected
Review.Contenu: Cost was much higher than expected. The quote provided up front was misleading.

Review.Titre: Was Quoted a price but was much higher…
Review.Contenu: Was Quoted a price but was much higher to recover data.

Review.Titre: They Recovered Most of the Data BUT the customer service was not so good.
Review.Contenu: Fields Data Recovery has a lot of bad press out there. I sent my hard drive to them before I read any of it. My hard drive was an external hard drive that was knocked off a desk and three feet onto the floor. Basically, the disk was still in one piece but the head was knocked off, (and I was later told damaged, which I can never truly confirm given my lack of knowledge on these things). Once they got my drive it was a game of un-kept deadlines. First it was 48 hours, which turned into next week, which turned into the next Monday. I think it took a good 10 days to get a price quote and a report on how much of the data they could recover.  They would be able to recover 95% of my data and it would cost me $850. I paid it. Then I took another two weeks to get the disks back from them. There was various excuses. I was promised it would ship this day and it never would. Finally when it did ship, I was promised a tracking number. I think I finally got the tracking number the day before or the day that the disks arrived.  Its hard to say if they really got 95% of my data back. The disk was full of photos. I noticed some missing photos but I also noticed a lot of double and triple of the same photo. So while they may have gotten 95% of the data volume, I am not 100% sure they got 95% of the files. If that makes sense.  So overall, they did the job they said they would do, not in the time frame they promised. From my more tech savy friends, the price was a good price. I got most of my photos back and that is what I wanted. If I ever get in this situation again, I will likely shop around a little more to see what else it out there. Not saying I would not use them but I would definitely take more time to compare.
Price was over the top, but I needed my photos.

Review.Titre: took a bit long to get files back
Impressive right up to the quote.
Review.Contenu: I was very impressed with the service and process to get my drive there.  I had a centralized home NAS that was 2GB fail.  I had a little less than 200 MB of data that needed to be recovered, mostly pictures of my girls that were not backed up anywhere else.  I received an initial estimate that I thought was acceptable.  I sent my drive out and found that I had 95% data integrity with no physical damage.  However, the quote to restore the data went up dramatically (about 150%). I couldn't justify the quote that was higher than the professional services from Seagate.  I requested the drive be sent back to me so I could figure out an alternative solution or save up the money.  A week later after I expected the drive to arrive I received a phone call asking about restoring the data to a drive I would provide near in the middle of the original quote.  I did approve the restore.I initially explained that I understand they are providing a service and for the most part a good service with great updates.  However, I felt that there was a severe injustice with the large price hike.  I understand they have time, software, hardware, etc. invested to provide this service and that the initial quote/estimate is just that, an estimate.  However, with no physical damage and a high percentage of data integrity I was very disappointed with the high quoted price. I felt like a hostage and was very disappointed not only in how this went down, but that I had data I desperately wanted.  When they called back I agreed to the reduced price and asked why the reduction.  The rep said that his manager wanted to earn my business and recoup some of their cost.  It felt very much like they tried to get as much as possible from me then settled for a reasonable amount.  Again, I was willing to pay an appropriate fee, but I felt that I had been taken advantage of.All in all, the process was great with many updates and quality work.  However, when it comes to quotes and cost, be cautious.  Or wait and they might end up reducing the cost.  Again, if it was a business need and the data critical to operations I have no doubt it would be worth it.  However, with my circumstances cost was a factor and we eventually got to an appropriate level, but not the best experience.

Review.Titre: Recovery ervice was performed as requested and was successful; communication between us and the recovery team was difficult.
Review.Contenu: We had a hard drive failure and Fields Data was able to recover the data for us.  We found the price a bit steep--$800 rather than the $199 in the ads, but they were willing to work on a private and non-corporate issue.  We had quotes of $2000 just to diagnose the problem from more corporately oriented companies.  We sent in our hardware and we got the diagnostic and results as promised.  However communication was not all it could be--results could only be viewed with Chrome browser or Safari--and that was not specified.  Once we knew this, we could see from their report that the data we were interested in was recovered, and we happily gave them our credit card.  But we were not informed that by paying with a credit card we would incur a overseas transaction fee because the charge was by a British bank, so $25.00 was added to the $819 quoted which we were not expecting.  Had we known this  we might have chosen another kind of payment.  We gave them authority to charge our card on 1/14/2014, but we did not receive our data.  We called the recovery specialist using a cell phone he was not familiar with he answered and told us that his office had had a hard drive failure of their own.  Once again he promised to send the data.  When we got our credit card statement without any e-mail that the data had been shipped, we disputed the charge.  The next day, we had an e-mail that the data had been shipped, and 4 days later we got the DVD with the data.  We then un-disputed the charge.  On the whole, our experience was positive with regard to performance, unsatisfactory with regard to communication, and OK with regard to cost.  The specialist tried to blame delays on our only having given him a PO Box, but we were never asked for a physical address.  We had asked to have the data shipped with tracking info but this was not done.  Finally the data arrived by USPS priority mail about 2 days after we were told to expect it.  All our mail comes to a PO Box.  Even the UPS drivers occasionally drop packages off at the post office for our PO Box.  On the whole, our experience was positive with regard to performance, unsatisfactory with regard to communication, and OK with regard to cost.   The company delivered on its promises finally, and possibly under pressure.  They could work on their communication with customers would be our main criticism, but on the whole we would recommend them.

My experience was overall positive.  Communication with Julian was great and easy, he's a really good person and helped me through the process well. Obviously getting my data back was huge but he really made the experience very pleasant for such a stressful situation.I take a star away because their online payment system wouldn't process my card after multiple attempts, even after preauthorizing my bank to run the transaction.   Then after being out of cell service for a few days I returned to a message that if I didn't pay they were going to charge $500 extra as a storage fee (yikes).    I was able to provide my information over the phone eventually but they need to update/change their online payment platform.

Review.Titre: I’d do it again but I hope I don’t have to.
Review.Contenu: The advertisement was somewhat misleading and the up front communication seemed a bit tricky. Like they were trying to scare me into feeling fortunate when they were able to recover the data for $2000. Eventually we came to an agreement and the recovery was flawless. I have the use of all of my data and they were very quick about it. Overall a good experience.

Review.Titre: Do what they claim, at their own pace
Review.Contenu: Unfortunately, towards the end of the school year I lost all of my curriculum on my external hard drive. Fields retrieved my data for roughly $1200. They did a great job recovering the data and for that I am truly grateful. I would have appreciated more updates on their part. More communication would have made the process less stressful and confusing.

Fields-data recovery recovered most of the data from my external drive including all of the important documents I need. I was quoted a very high price from a competitor. Fields Data beat that price by a few hundred dollars. I was hoping the price wouldn't be as high - but I now have peace of mind knowing I have my documents!

Review.Titre: This is my first time using Fields
Review.Contenu: This is my first time using Fields. I reformatted three different SSD cards more than once because I didn't know what that meant. Lost everything from several trips. I was told that it would be hard to recover and that they couldn't get everything back. Of course I was upset but they recovered more than what I expected. 95%! I had read some reviews that this was a scam site, you didn't get what you paid for, too expensive, ect. I didn't experience that. And going to several other places, the price was good. I'm so happy I get to relive my trips again.

Review.Titre: They were able to recover my data…
Review.Contenu: They were able to recover my data fully. However I had sent them my new personal hard drive I had purchased and asked them to transfer the data however received a different hard drive and received back my personal hard drive a week later. This is not how I had expected nor what I had wanted but the transfer was possible so I was very grateful to have them recover my data.

I was very worried about sending my hard drive for repair to Fields Data Recovery after negative experience with another company. My hard drive had a mechanical issue with a head after it felt on the floor.They provide free diagnostic including shipping your hard drive back if you decided not to continue with them. They responded with a prognosis in a timely manner thinking they would be able to recover the data. Later they were able to provide the full list of recovered data and quote for that, so you know exactly what you are paying for. This kind of fixes are expensive – the final quote came back higher than site description, but it was still much more reasonable than the other companies charge. I ended up paying $1K+ for my hard drive repair. The Fields representative Julian Henson kept me informed all the way and was very polite, patient, and responsive.It also took a little longer than discussed, but I was not in a rush, and it worked fine for me. The whole process took about 3-4 weeks including shipping.Reference - WO-003708

Fields Data Recovery was communicative all through the process and very up front about their fees.  It took a little extra effort, but all of my data was recovered from my drive and return to me on a USB Drive.  I hope I will never need their services again, but I would not hesitate to use them again or recommend them.

Was very pleased with the customer service and data recovery services provided. They were able to retrieve all of my data! They asked if I wanted the old disk back, to which I said yes, but then never sent it. That’s the only reason why this wasn’t a 5-star review.

Review.Titre: I have to admit that I had my reservations, but they exceeded my expectations
Review.Contenu: I have to admit that I had my reservations about data recovery. My experience with other companies had been very bad. And this was a critical system PC on a municipality waste water facility.But, although it took a little longer than I would have liked (an additional week),and it was more expensive than I had expected, they did a great job recovering the data. Because of their knowledge and technical expertise, I did not have to rewrite and start from scratch to get the front end of the plant up and going.Thanks. I highly recommend these guys. I will definitely use them again.

Great service provided. Friendly people. A life saver for me as my external drive has ALL my Ancestry on it. Facts. Ledgers. Photos. They were able to retrieve all of it. My only issue was complete sticker shock at the cost to retrieve my data. I spent my career in Telecommunications and I am very familiar with data retrieval, and it was triple what it should have cost. But I had no choice! So, beware and ask specific questions about cost. My "personal" data retrieval was small compared to what is I would imagine professional working folks might have.

I have had a very pleasant experience with FDR. Everyone was courteous over the phone. The recovery process was explained clearly. I received all my data back in just a few days. I would have given 5 stars if it had been less expensive.

Review.Titre: Had an external drive fail that was not…
Review.Contenu: Had an external drive fail that was not backed up (I knew better) that contained photos and video projects.  Fields service was great from the initial contact.  The turn around time was fast.  Was it pricey?  Yes, it was an expensive lesson learned, but most all the data was recovered successfully and I now have a plan in place.
Did a professional job of recovering data from my hard disk at the agreed price, which was not cheap.  Subsequently have kept badgering me to write a review

Everything was very professional and handled quickly. It was very expensive, but the memories were irreplaceable. I did a lot of research and decided to use Fields because of the quality reviews, and they did not disappoint.

Review.Titre: They went the extra mile for me.
Review.Contenu: They were very helpful to me in obtaining data from an external hard drive that had gone bad.  They were even very helpful in pricing for recovering the data.  I would use them again in the future.

Review.Titre: They did a fine job of recovering my…
Review.Contenu: They did a fine job of recovering my data but the initial estimate was over my budget. They later made a lower offer that I found feasible.
Sent my son's unresponsive portable hard drive to Fields.  They were able to recover the data.It was expensive, but we decided it was worth it.We were very pleased.

Review.Titre: The work was efficient and timely
Review.Contenu: The work was efficient and timely. However, there was some communication issues up front about how the process works and cost.

I sent in my hard drive with free shipping, and I got a phone call letting me know that they got the package a day or two after sending. A few days later I received another call, this one telling me how they were unable to fully diagnose the cause the problem, but before they could try to correct the drive failure, they would need to replace some old parts in the device to make sure it was in working order before tackling the problem. They gave me an estimate on the repair price and told me that if I then wanted to go through with the data recovery afterwards, that will cost more based on man power, and if they are successful in retrieving the data the price would be more. The man on the phone asked me if I wished to proceed and I decided it best not to. With that, my device was soon shipped back with no charge and in the same condition I had sent it, with the rubber case and charger along with my device. Even through I decided not to go through with the repairs, the whole process had been easy and smooth. The man I spoke to on the phone, John I believe, was very kind and informative. The shipping was free. My item came back in the same good condition I sent it along with it's accessories. Even if I did not go through the whole service, in all I would say it is a great service that would recommend to others.

Review.Titre: A little expensive for my liking. But good non the less
Review.Contenu: Cost was almost $1000 which was pretty steep but I had almost a terabyte of data lost so it was still pretty worth it at the end.

Review.Titre: They get it done as advertised.
Review.Contenu: Expensive, but I got all my data back and quickly. Their customer service was excellent.
Very happy that they were able to recover my files. It was somewhat expensive but I am very happy with the results.

Review.Titre: Everything was done in a timely manner…
Review.Contenu: Everything was done in a timely manner and I got the files that I needed. I admit that I don't know how much labor is involved but the price seems high to me.

Review.Titre: Excellent tailored service, but international bank charge may surprise you.
Review.Contenu: Their service was extremely tailored to me, which was excellent. I always felt I had close attention paid to me. They were able to save a great chunk of my data as well, (not all of it, but a fair amount). One small negative was that I received an international charge from my bank from paying them. It wasn't huge, but it was a small annoyance, because I thought they were based in MO or something, but apparently not.

Review.Titre: Fields Recovery Data did a great job of…
Review.Contenu: Fields Recovery Data did a great job of recovering my critical files from my damaged external hard drive. I was concerned because those files were very important and I thought I had lost them. I appreciate their work, also supplying me with a USB Drive with my recovered information and they covered the round-trip shipping costs, which others do not. It's a bit pricey, but in the market price range. Thank you.

They recovered my data without any problem.  But the amount I was quoted over the phone to retrieve my date was nowhere near what I eventually paid.  What choice did I have at that point, I needed my data.  They sent me my essential data quickly so I could be up and running but when I received the drive that was to have all the data I requested, all of it wasn't on there and I had to call to get the rest of my data.  I was just relived to get my data back.

Review.Titre: Fields Data Recovery was friendly and…
Review.Contenu: Fields Data Recovery was friendly and efficient and, most importantly, successfully recovered all my data, despite my laptop hard drive being harder to recover than we initially thought it would be. The price seemed very high, but they called me throughout the process to explain what was happening and what they had to do which I appreciate. Also, to be fair, the price may have been cheaper compared to many alternative businesses, I just don't know.

Very professional & they keep you informed on their progress. They were able to retrieve data off my dead remote hard drive that my local computer shop couldn’t. I tried another data retrieval company in StL first but their drop off communication lacked. I even drove 45 minutes to drop off hard drive & this other company had moved to a different location. My only complaint is they are expensive but they charge nothing unless they can retrieve the data & you agree with their charges. They worked with me on a fair price.

I have received excellent service from Fields Data.  My data was restored in a timely manner.  There was only one incident where my drive was confused with another customers drive, but that was cleared up promptly when the error was discovered.  The customer care was excellent.  I would recommend this company for data recovery.

Review.Titre: I was very pleased with the customers…
Review.Contenu: I was very pleased with the customers service which was excellent in every way.  Most importantly, I was pleased that they were able to recover my data and return it to me in promptly (about 10 days).My only complaint is that the price went from the $250-500 estimate range before sending the drive to $750. In all fairness, I was warned ahead of time that it was not an actual estimated, but most jobs were in that price range.  Ultimately, I was happy with the price I received.

Review.Titre: A Happy Client .While price point on…
Review.Contenu: A Happy Client .While price point on data recovery is a difficult pill to swallow, I was pleased that Fields was competitive.  The service was excellent and considering the personal value of my data, I was thrilled by the clean room's complete recovery.  Hopefully, I won't have to learn the backup lesson twice.  If I had to, I'd definitely go back to  Fields for assistance.

Review.Titre: my brother had an external hard drive…
Review.Contenu: my brother had an external hard drive that got dropped.  I was unable to get it to mount in Windows or Linux, so I sent it to these guys.  It took them a day or so to send me a list of what  files were recoverable (most all of them) and then I had them perform the recovery.  They sent me a new external drive that had all my brothers file on it.  He was very happy to have it back.

Really had my doubts, read reviews and noticed my conversations seemed to follow the script as noted by other reviews who claimed scam. After calling and talking to the Fields manager about my concerns, they told me they would complete the data recovery ensuring there would be no more costs. Got a new hard drive back with all my lost data. Was more than elated, actually called them and apologized for my doubts. They did exactly what they said they would and got my data recovered.

Review.Titre: They did what they said they would do…
Review.Contenu: They did what they said they would do (recover data from a damaged hard drive).  It was rather expensive.  At times there was an issue with communication regarding the agreed upon fee, but we did resolve this and I paid what was agreed to before the work took place.  All in all it was a good experience.

Although the turn-around time was slightly longer than I was comfortable with I would recommend this service to anyone.  I had a hard drive that had physical defects and they went out of the way to secure parts to rebuild my data.  In the end I was able to have access to more than 99% of what was lost.  Thank God.  Some of what I had was impossible to duplicate otherwise.

The agent who took my order was helpful and knowledgeable and was generally easy to reach when I needed to call him back or ask questions. The process of receiving my data back took a little longer than they originally said, but it turned out to be a more complicated problem. Cost was also a surprising factor as it was about twice what I'd expected to pay, but overall, I was happy and everything worked out great.

Very efficient and professional service. My external disk drive was dropped and would not start or mount. It has been a convenient drive to swap between 2 computers but I neglected to backup after some time. Lesson learned. My only hesitation going to 5 stars was I felt it was expensive. When something like this happens with lots of important data at stake I quickly approved the expense. There was no other way to recapture much of the data. Fields response was quick and thorough.

Review.Titre: Would recommend! Pleasure to work with!
Review.Contenu: Fields Data Recovery was a pleasure to work with and did manage to recover my data from a hard drive with crashed heads. While taking about 2 months to do so and originally being much more expensive than I expected or desired, after talking to a manager they were able to drop the price and got ALL my data returned to me. Would recommend, will take a bit of time to get your data and do stay in touch with them but overall good experience

Review.Titre: The data recovery was done very well…
Review.Contenu: The data recovery was done very well and very quick. And of the quality of the work was good. The people we interacted with were very friendly and helpful. We did not like the price negotiation. Personally, I like it better when I get a sharp price at the start. But that is the only thing. I would recommend fields data recovery and would use them again.

Nice people.  Good customer service.  Data recovery was so-so.  It looked better than it was.  Many (most ) of the recovered files were either corrupted to the point where they could not be opened or the data in them was not readable.  When they quoted the number of files recovered I thought most of my data had been recovered, but trying to use the files, I found more like 20% was usable.  But better than nothing.

Review.Titre: I was relieved to have a professional…
Review.Contenu: I was relieved to have a professional service help recover files from an old external hard drive that was no longer working. It represented a huge amount of travel and personal photography that i absolutely did not want to lose. I was satisfied with the recovery process, the level of service, speed and follow-up.

After sending in over 1TB of photo and video files, I received the new hard drive and probably 95% of the recovered data within a few days. I communicated mainly with Dylan, who was very helpful. I'm not giving 5 stars only because I have no idea if I overpaid, based on my lack of knowledge of the market.

Both the customer rep and service rep were kind and professional.  The whole process went rather quickly (from time of shipment of my devices to return of extracted data and devices).  All though it was not cheap, I got back what I was aiming for in the endeavor.

It appears that all important data was recovered. Overall very satisfied. Was able to negotiate a lower more appropriate price. Hard drive was returned promptly. I was able to read data directly from hard drive when it was returned. Recovered data was returned on flash drive. Recommend use of flash drive other than ADATA. Service was timely in way of getting necessary shipping labels, etc.

I don't normally respond to surveys or reviews, but since you were able to recover all of the data from years of accumulated files that were on my damaged drive, I felt a "thank you" is warranted. It was distressing for me to face the potential of losing all of those files. After I realized that it takes more than the local teenage, techie wannabe to do what you folks do, I was appreciative that you were able to retrieve all of them, so I was willing to pay for that service. Thank you for your help.

My external drive froze and I couldn't access over 28,000 images.  Checked out two vendors and these guys seemed to be the better option based on price, experience, reviews and time to recover the data.  They did as promised and I was able to get to all images back except 2.  One small glitch was quickly addressed, the initial return was incomplete. Once contacted the fully recovered drive was returned to me.

Great initial experience from the sales rep, however I wish that they would have been a little more up front with what the end costs could have been when I asked for an estimate on what I would expect from the data recovery. I got all of my files though, so very happy, even if it cost an arm and a leg. It's the price I paid for my own stupidity though so I can't fault the company. Just a little better communication about expectations would have been appreciated.

Review.Titre: I have had to use this company twice…
Review.Contenu: I have had to use this company twice now unfortunately. Once they were able to get my data back (dead hard-drive) another time they were not (more physical damage to spinning disk). Were fast and had a variety of price points for how fast I wanted my data back

Review.Titre: good service, price a little high the last time
Review.Contenu: I have brought 5 clients to fields so far. I the case of the first 4 clients the service was very good, price reasonable (>$200), the last one was very good service but price was more than double (nearly $500). I can't bring customers to fields like that. I want to continue bringing clients to fields because the service is good, but I can't present $1000 invoices. We need to work something out.

Review.Titre: Good service and price after negotiations
Review.Contenu: The first quote was extremely high so I decided not to recover . After some additional conversation , a new price was communicated which was substantially lower . Recovery was completed and all data was returned . the price I paid was still a lot but much less than 1st quoted. Make sure you research what your failure might be, before you just send your data away

Fields earning the stars based on the definition "decent treatment" very litlle friction.Did what they promised though not quite as quickly.  Keep me informed but mostly when I asked.  Recovered lots of data but not as much as would have hoped for.  charged their original estimate but a bit pricey

After three years, I finally worked up the courage to get a data recovery estimate on the USB drive that housed 14 GB of photos/videos. As a graduate student, I am on a budget. The initial estimate was way too far out of my price range and so I asked for my USB to be returned, hoping to one day proceed with the process when I started my career! The man I was working with agreed, but responded a week later with a quote that was half the price. I proceeded with the recovery and now have all of my data back!! So grateful for the specific employee and Fields! If you can afford it, do it!

Had a Samsung SSD that failed. Contacted Fields Data Recovery and they quoted me a price between $200 & $400.  They arranged for shipment of the drive. Once they received the drive, (overnight) they went to work on it.  It took about 4 days or so and I was told that they recovered 95% of the data. I was mostly concerned with my pictures and they got them all back for me. The only downside was the end price ended up being double to quote.

Review.Titre: Complete 100% recovery of my lost date.
Review.Contenu: Fields did everything on schedule and I had a complete recovery of all my lost picture date from my damaged hard drive. I had a  couple of phone conversations with Fields reps and they were very friendly and informative.  All went as planed an I received my lost data on a flash drive as in a timely manner. Very happy with the results!!

Review.Titre: Fields Data Recovery has a heart.
Review.Contenu: A church member who has fallen on hard times had their laptop computer hard drive crash.  Lots of pictures and videos were at risk for permanent loss.  The church sent the hard drive to Fields Data Recovery.  They were very prompt and efficient in the recovery of all the data that they could.  However, the initial cost proposal was well beyond the ability of our church to pay.  I proposed an alternative price.  They accepted an amount that was a bit less.

Review.Titre: I had a broken tablet notebook that I…
Review.Contenu: I had a broken tablet notebook that I had taken to 3 repair places and nobody could get my data off of it for me. One place recommended Data Recovery so I sent it to them. I ended up waiting 3 months to get my data and paid $890 to get it but they were able to recover data that I desperately needed for my job when nobody else could. If you HAVE to get info off of a broken device and would pay anything for it, send it here. My advice is to be ready to call your customer service rep often to keep current on the state of your repair.

An expensive lesson learned, don't forget to back up your data.  Yes it cost a lot, but they were able to save almost all of my data.  I was told what the price was going to be up front and how much of my data they would be able to recover, leaving the decision to me if it was worth it.  There was a thorough explanation of what they would be able to do and it was done very quickly.  I had my documents and photos within a couple of days.  I would recommend them to anyone who thinks there's no hope to recover their data.

They where able to recover the precious data on our damaged hard drive. The drive heads were damaged and they worked hard to remove the drive disks and fix the drive to recover the data. I also appreciated the way that they returned the data with a high capacity solid state drive. I have since learned my lesson and I now archive my data to a secure cloud. The best thing that I like about this recovery service is that they communicated with me every step of the way, and they were very upfront with what was wrong with the drive and also the costs for recovering the data.

Review.Titre: I sent in a hard drive that crashed…
Review.Contenu: I sent in a hard drive that crashed almost two years prior to see if they could recover the data. The responded with a prognosis in a timely manner thinking they would be able to recover the data and I hired them. I paid extra for a level of expedited service and became anxious after I had not heard from them for several weeks after paying the $1k+ bill - but eventually they sent a hard drive with all the files as far as I can recall. After reading some negative reviews, I was worried it was a scam, but I ended up feeling pretty happy with the service.

Review.Titre: Very good recovery, would recommend for for anybody who need files recovered.
Review.Contenu: Good recovery, recovered all my files that were missing previously; however,  I had to replace my folders that contained my files that were recovered and replace them with new ones because they were left corrupted from the recovery process. Still, I greatly recommend the service to anyone who needs their necessary files recovered.

Fields neither over promised nor under delivered. That's as it should be. It's my understanding that until recovery work is completed, there's no accurate way to state the likelihood of percentage of data which can be recovered. Communication throughout the process was professional from a technical (what's possible) to a customer service (handholding) perspective. I hope never again to need their services, but should the need arise, Fields will be my first call for help.

Fields Data Recovery is very consumer-oriented and provides very high quality service. I was very pleased to have my data recovered quickly and returned to me in a format I could use. The technicians described the process to me and followed through on all of their promises. The only downside for me was the expense. As this was a home computer with only a few relatively small files, I felt the cost was too high. Around $300 to $400 would seem more reasonable for the type of job. Nevertheless, I was happy to have the data restored. Thank you.

Review.Titre: I was a little shocked at the amount …
